ceu: <entryFree id="n7648" type="main" key="ceu"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ceu</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>contr. from ce-ve, like neu and seu, from neve and sive</etym>, a particle of equality or comparison, <sense id="n7648.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as</hi> (in the ante-Aug. per., peculiar to more elevated poetry; <cit><quote lang="la">later also in prose, in Seneca and Suet., and esp. freq. in Plin. H. N.): pars vertere terga, ceu quondam petiere rates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 492</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu talpae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 6, 7, § 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu notamus in muscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 48, 108, § 258</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 37, 61, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 12, 62, § 187</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7648.1" n="II" level="1"> In <usg type="style">poet.</usg> comparisons (hence, haud aliter follows in a corresponding clause, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:797" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 797</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 360</bibl>, or sic, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 729</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">like</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like as</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenuis fugit ceu fumus in auras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 740</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:542" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 542</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hecuba et natae... Praecipites atrā ceu tempestate columbae,... sedebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 516</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 4, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu nubibus arcus Mille jacit varios adverso sole colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 88</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 527</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7648.2" n="b" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as when</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 303</bibl>: 4, 96; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:673" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 673</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 30</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 792</bibl>; 10, 97; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:24:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 24, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7648.3" n="c" level="4"> With <hi rend="ital">si</hi> (twice in Lucr.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 620</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:161" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 161</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7648.4" n="B" level="2"> Sometimes in a conditional sense, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as it were</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like as if</hi>, etc., Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 483, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thesea ceu pulsae ventorum flamine nubes Aërium nivei montis liquere cacumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 239</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">per aperta volans, ceu liber habenis, Aequora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 194</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 28, 28, § 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:132" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 37, 61, § 132</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:175" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 18, 54, § 175</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:52" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:320" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 320</bibl>.— Hence, with a <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu cetera nusquam Bella forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:438" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 438</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:378" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 378</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:6" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:417" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 2, 417</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 10, 18</bibl>. § 41; 31, 1, 1, § 2; 34, 6, 13, § 28 al.—</sense><sense id="n7648.5" n="C" level="2"> In the Nat. Hist. of Pliny sometimes ceu vero = quasi vero, in refuting another's opinion, <hi rend="ital">as if</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just as if</hi>: ceu vero nesciam adversus Theophrastum scripsisse etiam feminam, Plin. praef. § 29; 7, 55, 56, § 188; 11, 39, 92, § 226; 12, 1, 5, § 11 al.; cf. upon this word, Hand, Turs. II. pp. 45-49.</sense></entryFree>
ceus: <entryFree id="n7649" type="main" key="Ce_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Cea, I. B.</entryFree>
ceutrones: <entryFree id="n7650" type="main" key="Ceutrones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Ceutrones</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7650.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Gallic tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceva: <entryFree id="n7651" type="foreign" key="ce_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēva</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">ceua</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Low Germ. Keue</etym>, <sense id="n7651.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small cow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cevenna: <entryFree id="n7652" type="main" key="Ce^venna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕvenna</orth> (also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĕbenna</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Gĕ-benna</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7652.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Gallia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cevennes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 434</bibl>.—The same: <cit><quote lang="la">Cebennici or Gebennici montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:5:6" default="NO">2, 5, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceveo: <entryFree id="n7653" type="main" key="ce_veo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēveo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype> (<sense id="n7653.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> cevi, without voucher in Prob. p. 1482 P.), <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>Sanscr. kju, to agitate one's self; cf. quatio</etym>. </sense><sense id="n7653.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To move the haunches</hi>, Plaut. Fragin. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 84, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:21" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:40" default="NO">9, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:95:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 95, 13</bibl>; cf. criso.—* </sense><sense id="n7653.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (the figure taken from the wagging of the tail of a dog), <hi rend="ital">to fawn</hi>, <hi rend="ital">flatter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:87" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 87</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ceyx: <entryFree id="n7654" type="greek" key="ce_yx"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cēÿx</orth>, <itype>ȳcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kh/u+c</foreign>, <sense id="n7654.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the male kingfisher</hi> (the female, halcyon), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 8, 27, § 86</bibl>.—Personified: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cēyx</orth>, <itype>ȳcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kh/u+c</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a son of Lucifer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Trachis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and husband of Alcyone.</hi> Having suffered shipwreck at Delphi, he and his wife were changed to kingfishers, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17</bibl> (18), 81; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 11, 272</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 544</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 739</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 1, 399</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Gr. Cēȳca, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:727" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 727</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chabrias: <entryFree id="n7655" type="main" key="Chabri^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chabrĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xabri/as</foreign>, <sense id="n7655.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished Athenian general;</hi> v. his life in Cornel. Nepos.</sense></entryFree>
chaere: <entryFree id="n7656" type="greek" key="chaere"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chaere</orth>, <pos>interj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xai=re</foreign>, <sense id="n7656.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">hail!</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:prol. 8" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> prol. 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chaerea: <entryFree id="n7657" type="main" key="Chaere^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chaerĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*xaire/as</foreign>), <sense id="n7657.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:17 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 17 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. Sap. 18:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. Sap. 18, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chaereas: <entryFree id="n7658" type="main" key="Chaere^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chaerĕas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xaire/as</foreign>, <sense id="n7658.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Grecian proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7658.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A writer on husbandry</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 99, § 263</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7658.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A sculptor of the time of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chaerephylum: <entryFree id="n7659" type="main" key="chaere^phy^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chaerĕphylum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. caerefolium. <cb n="CHAL" /></entryFree>
chaeronea: <entryFree id="n7660" type="main" key="Chaero_ne_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chaerōnēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xairw/neia</foreign>, <sense id="n7660.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Bœotian town on the Cephisus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">where Philip of Macedon conquered the Greeks;</hi> the birthplace of Plutarch; now the village <hi rend="ital">Kaprena</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Kapurna</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 12, § 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 46, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalasticamen: <entryFree id="n7661" type="main" key="cha^lasti^ca_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălastĭcāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>chalasticus</etym>, <sense id="n7661.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alleviating remedy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalasticus: <entryFree id="n7662" type="greek" key="cha^lasti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălastĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalastiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7662.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to alleviating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soothing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit> and 15: <cit><quote lang="la">unctiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 28, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chalatorius: <entryFree id="n7663" type="greek" key="cha^la_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>chalo</etym>, <sense id="n7663.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to loosing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">letting down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">funes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chalazias: <entryFree id="n7664" type="greek" key="cha^la_zi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălāzĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalazi/as [xa/laza</foreign>, hail], <sense id="n7664.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the form and color of hail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 189</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalazion: <entryFree id="n7665" type="main" key="cha^la_zi^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălāzĭon</orth>, v. chalazius.</entryFree>
chalazius: <entryFree id="n7666" type="greek" key="cha^la_zi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălāzĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xa/laza</foreign>, hail</etym>, <sense id="n7666.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to hail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <trans><tr>a precious stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 43, § 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7666.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chălā-zĭon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xala/zion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a pimple</hi> or <hi rend="ital">small tubercle on the eyelids</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 7, 2</bibl>, Caption: de chalazio palpebrarum (written as Greek in the text).</sense></entryFree>
chalbane: <entryFree id="n7667" type="greek" key="chalba^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalbănē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. galbanum.</entryFree>
chalcanthum: <entryFree id="n7668" type="greek" key="chalcanthum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcanthum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xa/lkanqon</foreign> [<foreign lang="greek">xalko/s-a)/nqos</foreign>], <sense id="n7668.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">copperas-water;</hi> pure Lat. atramentum sutorium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 32, § 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcaspis: <entryFree id="n7669" type="greek" key="chalcaspis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcaspis</orth>, <itype>idis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xa/lkaspis</foreign>, <sense id="n7669.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a brazen shield</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41, 2</bibl> Weissenb.; cf. aglaspis.</sense></entryFree>
chalcedon: <entryFree id="n7670" type="main" key="Chalce_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcēdon</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Calchē-don</orth>), <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xalkhdw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n7670.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Bithynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the Thracian Bosporus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite Byzantium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:149 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 43, § 149 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:73" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 5, 18, § 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 56, 6</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Chalcedona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:959 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 959 al.</bibl>; cf. Mann. Asia Min. 3, p. 581 sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7670.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcēdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Chalcedon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Chalcedonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thrasymachus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">smaragdi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Rufin. 2, 55</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcēdŏnii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Chalcedonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalceos: <entryFree id="n7671" type="greek" key="chalce_o^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcēŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xa/lkeios</foreign>, <sense id="n7671.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prickly plant</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 16, 56, § 94</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcetum: <entryFree id="n7672" type="greek" key="chalce_tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcētum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7672.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown medicinal plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 25, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalceus: <entryFree id="n7673" type="greek" key="chalce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xa/lkeos</foreign>, <sense id="n7673.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brazen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of brass;</hi> only in <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcea</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">brazen things</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:95:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 95, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcidensis: <entryFree id="n7674" type="main" key="Chalci^densis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭdensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. 2. Chalcis, I. B. 2.</entryFree>
chalcidice: <entryFree id="n7675" type="greek" key="chalci^di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcĭdĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalkidikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n7675.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of lizard</hi>, = 1. chalcis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 5, 32, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcidicensis: <entryFree id="n7676" type="main" key="Chalci^di^censis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭdĭcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. 2. Chalcis, I. B. 3.</entryFree>
chalcidicum: <entryFree id="n7677" type="main" key="Chalci^di^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭdĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. Chalcis, I. B. 1. b.</entryFree>
chalcidicus: <entryFree id="n7678" type="main" key="Chalci^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. Chalcis, I. B. 1.</entryFree>
chalcioecos: <entryFree id="n7679" type="greek" key="Chalci^oecos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭoecos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xalki/oikos</foreign> (among the Greeks, an epithet of Athene, from her temple of brass), among the Romans, <sense id="n7679.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a temple of Minerva</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:36:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 36, 9</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,004:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Paus. 5, 2</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
chalciope: <entryFree id="n7680" type="main" key="Chalci^o^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xalkio/ph</foreign>. <sense id="n7680.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Æetes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Medea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and wife of Phrixus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 21" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16</bibl> (17), 232; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:479" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 479</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7680.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Wife of Mnesylus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Antiphus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 97" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcis: <entryFree id="n7681" type="greek" key="chalcis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalki/s</foreign>. <sense id="n7681.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fish of the herring kind</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:17:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 17, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 47, 71, § 154</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:162" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 51, 74, § 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7681.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A lizard with copper-colored spots on its back</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 3, 13, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:46" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 5, 17, § 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7682" type="main" key="Chalcis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis or ĭdŏs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xalki/s</foreign>. <sense id="n7682.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Chief town of the island Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite to Aulis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">connected by a bridge with the main land</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Egribo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Negroponte;</hi> also called <hi rend="ital">Chalcis Euboica</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Chalcis Eubœœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:4:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 227</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 21, § 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:191" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 37, 74, § 191</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:4:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 4, 1</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Gr. Chalcidos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:5:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 5, 227</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Chalcida, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 710</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7682.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, the <hi rend="ital">adjj.</hi>, </sense><sense id="n7682.2" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭ-dĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Chalcis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Eubœa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Chalcidian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euripus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:57:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 57, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 3:9:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gallinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 2, 4</bibl></cit> and 13: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:414" default="NO">5, 10, 414</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:454" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 454</bibl></cit>: versus, <hi rend="ital">of the poet Euphorion</hi>,<cb n="CHAM" />  <hi rend="ital">a native of Chalcis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 50</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:56" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nola,</quote> <trans><tr>founded by the Chalcidians</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:161" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 161</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7682.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Since Cumæ was a colony of Chalcis, <hi rend="ital">Cumœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arx,</quote> <trans><tr>Cumœ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:94" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 94</bibl></cit>- litora, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Cumœan Sibyl</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 3, 182</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7682.4" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭdĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a chamber at the corner of a basuica</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on each side of the tribunal</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Mon. Ancyr. 4:1" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Mon. Ancyr. 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 184" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 184</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3287</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3290</bibl> sq.; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52</bibl> Müll.— Also <hi rend="ital">a spacious chamber in Grecian houses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Odyss. 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">23</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, p. 149</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3</bibl>, p. 105.—</sense><sense id="n7682.5" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭdensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Chalcidian</hi>: Timagoras, <hi rend="ital">of Chalcis</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">*xalkideu/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:49:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 49, 6</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Chalcis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:38:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 38, 10 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7682.6" n="3" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chalcĭdĭcensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Chalcis</hi>: colonia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cumœ</hi> (cf. supra), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:16:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 16, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7682.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Arabia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 159</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7682.8" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 23, 19, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcites: <entryFree id="n7683" type="greek" key="chalci_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalkiths</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">xalki=tis</foreign>. <sense id="n7683.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Copperstone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copper ore</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 2, 2, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:117" default="NO" valid="yes">34, 12, 29, § 117</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 7, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7683.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone of a copper color</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:191" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 11, 73, § 191</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcophonos: <entryFree id="n7684" type="greek" key="chalco^pho_no^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcŏphōnŏs</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcophthon-gŏs</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37, 22</bibl>), i. <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalko/fwnos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">xalkofqoggos</foreign>, <sense id="n7684.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone ringing like brass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcosmaragdos: <entryFree id="n7685" type="greek" key="chalcosma^ragdo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcosmăragdŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalkosma/ragdos</foreign>, <sense id="n7685.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an emerald with veins of brass</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">malachite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 19, § 74</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalcus: <entryFree id="n7686" type="greek" key="chalcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chalcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7686.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a copper coin</hi>, the tenth (acc. to Gr. authors, the sixth or eighth) part of an obolus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 34, 109, § 185</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chaldaei: <entryFree id="n7687" type="main" key="Chaldaei"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chaldaei</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xaldai=oi</foreign>, <sense id="n7687.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Chaldœans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a people of Assyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in an early age</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for their knowledge of astronomy and astrology.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7687.1" n="A" level="2"> Of <hi rend="ital">the nation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">people</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:8:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 8, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7687.2" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">soothsayers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">astrologers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 42, 87</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl> sqq.; <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chaldaeus,</quote> <trans><tr>a soothsayer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5, 4</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Chaldaeūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 726</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7687.3" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7687.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chaldaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Chaldœan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 226</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7687.5" n="2" level="3"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the soothsayers</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">secta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 57, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:94" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7687.6" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chal-dăĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">genus praedicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:42:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 42, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 47, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chalo: <entryFree id="n7688" type="greek" key="cha^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălo</orth>, no <sense id="n7688.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xala/w</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to slacken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let down</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cymbala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13, p. 308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 13, p. 308</bibl></cit> Bip.: <cit><quote lang="la">culcitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 4, 23</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chalybeius: <entryFree id="n7689" type="greek" key="cha^ly^be_ius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălybēïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xalubh/i+os [xa/luy</foreign>], <sense id="n7689.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of steel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steel-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">massa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:405" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 405</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chalybes: <entryFree id="n7690" type="main" key="Cha^ly^bes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chălybes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xa/lubes</foreign>. <sense id="n7690.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A people in Pontus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">noted for their mines and their preparation of steel</hi> [chalybs, hence the name; acc. to others, on the contr., steel, <foreign lang="greek">xa/luy</foreign>, was named from them], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:197" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 56, 57, § 197</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 421</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 174 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7690.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A tribe on the river Chalybs in Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chalybs: <entryFree id="n7691" type="greek" key="cha^lybs1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chălybs</orth>, <itype>ybis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xa/luy</foreign>, <sense id="n7691.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">steel</hi> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:142 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 14, 41, § 142 sq.</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">vulnificus (because weapons were made of it),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 446</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">on account of its hardness: ferro durior et chalybe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:16:30" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 16, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 152" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:171" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 171</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:403" default="NO">2, 403</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7691.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the things made of it.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7691.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A sword</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strictus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 364" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 364</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7691.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A horse</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s bit</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:398" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 398</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7691.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The point of an arrow</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:518" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 518</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:342" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 342</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:107 al" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 107 al.</bibl>— </sense><sense id="n7691.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An iron rail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 547</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7692" type="main" key="Cha^lybs2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chălybs</orth>, <itype>ybis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7692.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river in Lusitania</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 3, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cham: <entryFree id="n7693" type="main" key="Cham"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cham</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, <sense id="n7693.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Noah</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Ham</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:9:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 9, 18</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
chama: <entryFree id="n7694" type="greek" key="cha^ma1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chăma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7694.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lynx</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 19, 28, § 70</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n7695" type="greek" key="cha_ma2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chāma</orth>, v. chema.</entryFree>
chamaeacte: <entryFree id="n7696" type="greek" key="cha^maeacte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaeactē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaia/kth</foreign>, <sense id="n7696.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwarf elder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">danewort</hi>: Sambucus ebulus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 8, 35, § 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:120" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 11, 73, § 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaecerasus: <entryFree id="n7697" type="greek" key="cha^maece^ra^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaecĕrăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaikera</foreign> <pb n="325" /> <cb n="CHAM" /> <foreign lang="greek">sos</foreign>, <sense id="n7697.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dwarf cherry-tree</hi>: Prunus chaemaecerasus, Jacq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 104</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaecissos: <entryFree id="n7698" type="greek" key="cha^maecisso^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaecissŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaikissos</foreign>, <sense id="n7698.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ground-ivy</hi>: Glecoma hederacea, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:135" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 15, 84, § 135</bibl> (ā, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 44, 799</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n7698.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of</hi> cyclaminus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 9, 69, § 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaecyparissos: <entryFree id="n7699" type="greek" key="cha^maecy^pa^risso^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaecypărissŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaikupa/rissos</foreign>, <sense id="n7699.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">ground-cypress</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 86, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaedaphne: <entryFree id="n7700" type="greek" key="cha^maedaphne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaedaphnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaida/fnh</foreign>, <sense id="n7700.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwarf laurel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 11, 39, § 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:172" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 27, 99, § 172</bibl>; 24, 15, 81, § 132.</sense></entryFree>
chamaedracon: <entryFree id="n7701" type="greek" key="cha^maedra^con"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaedrăcon</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaidra/kwn</foreign>, <sense id="n7701.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of African serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the ground-serpent</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaedrops: <entryFree id="n7702" type="main" key="cha^maedrops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaedrops</orth>, v. chamaerops.</entryFree>
chamaedrys: <entryFree id="n7703" type="greek" key="cha^maedrys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaedrys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamai/drus</foreign>, <sense id="n7703.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant wall-germander</hi>: Teucrium chamaedrys, Linn.; <cit><quote lang="la">in pure Lat. trixago,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaeleon: <entryFree id="n7704" type="greek" key="cha^maele^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaelĕon</orth>, <itype>ōnis and ontis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaile/wn</foreign>. <sense id="n7704.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of lizard that changes its color</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the chameleon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 33, 51, § 120</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:143" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 52, 73, § 143</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:12:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 12, 1 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7704.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Masc.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the carline thistle; masc.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 18, 21, § 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:143" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 13, 118, § 143</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaeleuce: <entryFree id="n7705" type="greek" key="cha^maeleuce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaeleucē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaileu/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n7705.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">colt</hi>'<hi rend="ital">sfoot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 85, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:30" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 6, 16, § 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaelygos: <entryFree id="n7706" type="greek" key="cha^maely^go^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaelygŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamai/lugos</foreign>, <sense id="n7706.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, otherwise called verbenaca, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaemelinus: <entryFree id="n7707" type="main" key="cha^maeme_li^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaemēlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaimh/linos</foreign>, <sense id="n7707.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of chamomile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> p. 4, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaemelon: <entryFree id="n7708" type="greek" key="cha^maeme_lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaemēlon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamai/mhlon</foreign> (lit. earth-apple, on account of the applelike smell of the blossoms), <sense id="n7708.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chamomile</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 21, 26, § 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jun. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 24</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">chămŏmilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 3, 2</bibl>; Macer. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:14, v. 550" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 14, v. 550</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaemyrsine: <entryFree id="n7709" type="greek" key="cha^maemyrsi_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaemyrsīnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaimursi/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n7709.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwarf myrtle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">butcher</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-broom</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 9, 83, § 165</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:27" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 7, 7, § 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaepeuce: <entryFree id="n7710" type="greek" key="cha^maepeuce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaepeucē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaipeu/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n7710.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the ground-larch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 86, § 136</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaepitys: <entryFree id="n7711" type="greek" key="cha^maepi^tys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaepĭtys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamai/pitus</foreign>, <sense id="n7711.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, called in pure Lat. abiga, <hi rend="ital">groundpine</hi>, said to have the power of producing abortion, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 6, 20, § 29</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 16, 19, § 112</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> chamaepityi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:175" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 29, 103, § 175</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> chamaepityn, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 8, 53, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaeplatanus: <entryFree id="n7712" type="greek" key="cha^maepla^ta^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaeplătănus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaipla/tanos</foreign>, <sense id="n7712.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dwarf platane</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 2, 6, § 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaerepes: <entryFree id="n7713" type="greek" key="cha^maere^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaerĕpes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamairepei=s</foreign> (creeping on the earth), <sense id="n7713.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dwarf palm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamaerops: <entryFree id="n7714" type="greek" key="cha^maerops"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaerops</orth>, <itype>ōpis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamai/rwy</foreign>, = chamaedrys, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 80, § 130</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 20</bibl> (others, chamaedrops = <foreign lang="greek">xamai/drwy</foreign>).</entryFree>
chamaesyce: <entryFree id="n7715" type="greek" key="cha^maesy_ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaesȳcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamaisu/kh</foreign>, <sense id="n7715.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wolf</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-milk</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ground fig</hi>: Euphorbia chamaesyce, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 83, § 134</bibl>; in <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 91</bibl>, erroneously interchanged with chamaeacte.</sense></entryFree>
chamaetortus: <entryFree id="n7716" type="greek" key="cha^maetortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămae-tortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibrida, from <foreign lang="greek">xamai/</foreign> and tortus</etym>, <sense id="n7716.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that creeps on the ground</hi>, Fronto de Oratt. 2, p. 254.</sense></entryFree>
chamaezelon: <entryFree id="n7717" type="greek" key="cha^maeze_lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămaezēlon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamai/zhlon</foreign>, <sense id="n7717.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> gnaphalion, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 10, 61, § 88</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamavi: <entryFree id="n7718" type="main" key="Cha^ma_vi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chămāvi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xamauoi/</foreign> Ptolem., <sense id="n7718.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people</hi>, orig. on the north shore of the Rhine even to the Lippe; <cit><quote lang="la">later, between the Weser and the Hercynian Forest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Mos. 434</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamedyosmos: <entryFree id="n7719" type="greek" key="cha^me_dy^osmo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămēdyosmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamhdu/osmos [xamai/-h(du/osmos</foreign>], pure Lat. ros marinus, <sense id="n7719.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rosemary</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamelaea: <entryFree id="n7720" type="greek" key="cha^me^laea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămĕlaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamelai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7720.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the dwarf olive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shrub</hi>: Cneorum tricoccon, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 15, 82, § 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes">15, 7, 7, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 133" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:200" default="NO">200</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chameunia: <entryFree id="n7721" type="greek" key="cha^meuni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămeunĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xameuni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7721.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a couch on the earth</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 52, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chamomilla: <entryFree id="n7722" type="main" key="cha^mo^milla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămŏmilla</orth>, v. chamaemelon.</entryFree>
chamulcus: <entryFree id="n7723" type="greek" key="cha^mu_lcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chămūlcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xamoulko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7723.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of machine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4, 14</bibl>. <cb n="CHAR" /></sense></entryFree>
chanaan: <entryFree id="n7724" type="main" key="Cha^na^a_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chănăān</orth>, contr. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chănān</orth>, <gen>f.</gen> <itype>indecl.</itype>, <sense id="n7724.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the land of Canaan</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Paiestine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 13, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:9:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 9, 22</bibl>.—Form Chanan, <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 2, 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chane: <entryFree id="n7725" type="greek" key="cha_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chānē</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">channē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xa/nh</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">xa/nnh</foreign>, <sense id="n7725.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of sea-fish;</hi> Ital. canna: Perca cabrilla, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:108" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 16, 23, § 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:153" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 11, 54, § 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chanius: <entryFree id="n7726" type="greek" key="chani^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chanĭus pēs</orth> = Molossus, <sense id="n7726.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foot consisting of three long syllables</hi>, ¯¯¯, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
chaon: <entryFree id="n7727" type="main" key="Cha_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chāon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7727.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Priamus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ancestor of the Chaones</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 335</bibl> Serv.</sense></entryFree>
chaones: <entryFree id="n7728" type="main" key="Cha_o^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chāŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xa/ones</foreign>, <sense id="n7728.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in the north-west part of Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">named after</hi> Chaon (v. the preced. art.), <hi rend="ital">the Chaonians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4</bibl>, prooem. § 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 3, 334 sq.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">acc. plur.</hi> Gr. Chaonas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Get. 135</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">their country</hi> was called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chā-ŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 335</bibl> Serv.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4</bibl>, prooem. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 5, 9</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7728.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7728.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chāŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Chaonian;</hi> also <hi rend="ital">of Epirus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:334" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 334</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:717" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 717</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 8</bibl></cit>: pater, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Jupiter</hi>, whose oracle was at Dodona, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 67</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:303" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 303</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">columbae,</quote> <trans><tr>which revealed the future at Dodona</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the oak forest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:99" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">truncus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:461" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 461</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vertex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>of acorns</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 3, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7728.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chāŏnis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Chaonian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ales, i.e. columba (v. the preced.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbos, i. e. quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 10, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quercus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1624" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1624</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chaos: <entryFree id="n7729" type="main" key="Cha^o^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăŏs</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăus</orth>, <case>abl.</case> Chao (other cases not used in the class. per.; <sense id="n7729.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Chaï, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 1, 664</bibl>; <case>dat.</case> Chaï, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 720</bibl> P.), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xa/os</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n7729.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The boundless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty space;</hi> as the kingdom of darkness, <hi rend="ital">the Lower World</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 404</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:84" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ib. 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:600" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 600</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 741" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 741</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:772" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 772</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:402" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 402</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">impersonated,</quote> <trans><tr>masc</tr>., <tr>god of the Lower World</tr>, <tr>father of Erebos and Nox</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:510" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 510</bibl></cit> (<case>acc.</case> Chaos); 6, 265; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 7, 8</bibl>; cf.: Janus... edidit hos sonos; <cit><quote lang="la">me Chaos antiqui, nam sum res prisca, vocabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:103" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 103</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7729.2" n="B" level="2"> Hence also, <hi rend="ital">immeasurable darkness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deep obscurity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cimmerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:92" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horridum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7729.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The confused</hi>, <hi rend="ital">formless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">primitive mass out of which the universe was made</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chaos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 299</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Chao,</quote> <trans><tr>since the creation of the world</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:347" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 347</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chara: <entryFree id="n7730" type="greek" key="chara"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chara</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7730.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a root</hi> unknown to us; perh. <hi rend="ital">wild cabbage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 48</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
characatus: <entryFree id="n7731" type="main" key="cha^ra^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chărăcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <etym><foreign lang="greek">xa/rac</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7731.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">provided with stakes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propped up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vineae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:4:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:16" default="NO">5, 5, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
characias: <entryFree id="n7732" type="greek" key="cha^ra^ci^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chărăcĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xaraki/as</foreign>. <sense id="n7732.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Eit for making poles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stakes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of reed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 36, 66, § 168</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7732.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A name of a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wolf</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-milk</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 39, § 62</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">chărăcītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 11, 73, § 119</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:146" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 14, 87, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
character: <entryFree id="n7733" type="greek" key="cha^racter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chăracter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xarakth/r</foreign>. <sense id="n7733.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An instrument for branding</hi> or <hi rend="ital">marking</hi>, etc.: character est ferrum coloratum, quo notae pecudibus inuruntur, <foreign lang="greek">xarakth/r</foreign> autem Graece, Latine forma dicitur, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 16, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7733.1" n="II" level="1"> Usu., <hi rend="ital">the mark</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sign burned</hi> or <hi rend="ital">imprinted.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7733.2" n="A" level="2"> Prop. (esp. upon animals): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrupedia charactere signare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">characterem infigere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Contr. Cresc. 1:30" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Contr. Cresc. 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7733.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a characteristic</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">character</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style</hi>, etc. (only ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">Luciliano charactere libelli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:2:17" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. E. 3, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 481</bibl> P. (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:134" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 15</bibl> (16), 5; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 1</bibl>, in which passages it is written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
characterismos: <entryFree id="n7734" type="greek" key="cha^racte_rismo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chăractērismŏs</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xarakthrismo/s</foreign> <sense id="n7734.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">characterization</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the making prominent of the characteristic marks</hi>, rhet. t. t. (pure Lat. descriptio, depictio), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 2, 21, 40</bibl>; Porphyr. ad <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charadra: <entryFree id="n7735" type="main" key="Chara^dra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Charădra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xara/dra</foreign>, <sense id="n7735.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Epirus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Enn.</author> Fragm. p. 166</bibl> Vahl.</sense></entryFree>
charadrius: <entryFree id="n7736" type="greek" key="cha^ra_^dri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chărā^drĭus</orth>, ïi, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xaradrio/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7736.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yellowish bird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 14, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charadrus: <entryFree id="n7737" type="main" key="Cha^ra_^drus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chărā^drus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7737.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Syria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 20, 18, § 79</bibl>. <cb n="CHAR" /></sense></entryFree>
charax: <entryFree id="n7738" type="main" key="Cha^rax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chărax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xa/rac</foreign>, <sense id="n7738.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fortress in the valley of Tempe</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Carisso</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 6, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7738.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the Persian Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 26, 30, § 124</bibl> sq.</sense></entryFree>
charaxo: <entryFree id="n7739" type="greek" key="cha^raxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chăraxo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xara/ssw</foreign>, <sense id="n7739.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scratch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engrave</hi> (late Lat.): ungulis genas, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 557: tabulae decalogo charaxatae, Aug. Alterc. Eccl. et Synag.</sense></entryFree>
charaxus: <entryFree id="n7740" type="main" key="Cha^raxus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăraxus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n7740.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Lapithœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 272</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7740.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A brother of Sappho</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chares: <entryFree id="n7741" type="main" key="Cha^res"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăres</orth>, <itype>ētis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7741.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek proper name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7741.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Athenian general</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,013:3 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Timoth. 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 2, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7741.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A statuary of Lindos in Rhodus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the favorite pupil of Lysippus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 41</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7741.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Grecian writer of Mitylene</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:2:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 2, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chariclo: <entryFree id="n7742" type="main" key="Cha^riclo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăriclo</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7742.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Ocyrhoë</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by the Centaur Chiron</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 636</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charis: <entryFree id="n7743" type="main" key="Cha^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăris</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, v. Charites.</entryFree>
charisius: <entryFree id="n7744" type="main" key="Cha^ri^si^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chărĭsĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xari/sios</foreign>. <sense id="n7744.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek orator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">imitator of Lysias</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:286" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:70" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7744.1" n="II" level="1"> Flavius Sosipater Charisius, <hi rend="ital">a Latin grammarian in the fourth Christian century.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n7744.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman jurist of the time of Constantine the Great.</hi></sense></entryFree>
charisma: <entryFree id="n7745" type="greek" key="cha^risma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chărisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xa/risma</foreign>, <sense id="n7745.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">present</hi>, Prud. prooem. Apotheos. 11; id. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 13, 61.</sense></entryFree>
charistia: <entryFree id="n7746" type="greek" key="cha^risti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chăristĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">car-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xari/steia</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">xaristh/ria</foreign>, <sense id="n7746.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an annual family repast made three days after the Parentalia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the 20th of February; a family banquet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at which existing family feuds were settled</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:617 sq" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 617 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 1, 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:56:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 56, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charisticum: <entryFree id="n7747" type="main" key="charisticum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">charisticum</orth>, v. chartiaticum.</entryFree>
charites: <entryFree id="n7748" type="main" key="Cha^ri^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chărĭtes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xa/rites</foreign>, <sense id="n7748.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Charites</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Graces</hi> (pure Lat. Gratiae), usu. three, <hi rend="ital">Aglaia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Euphrosyne</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Thalia</hi> (cf., however, Lidd. and Scott under the word), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:219" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 219</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:4:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 32</bibl>.—In <hi rend="ital">sing. acc.</hi> Gr. Charita, <hi rend="ital">one of the Graces</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 79</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charitonblepharon: <entryFree id="n7749" type="greek" key="cha^ri^tonble^pha^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chărĭtonblĕphăron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xari/twn-ble/faron</foreign> (eyelids of the Graces), <sense id="n7749.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magical plant producing love</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 25, 52, § 142</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charmadas: <entryFree id="n7750" type="main" key="Charma^das"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Charmădas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xarma/das</foreign>. <sense id="n7750.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An Academic philosopher</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pupil of Carneades</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 6, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7750.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek painter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charmides: <entryFree id="n7751" type="main" key="Charmi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Charmĭdes</orth>, <itype>ai or i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7751.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comic person</hi> in Plaut. Trin.; hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">charmĭdātus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">changed into</hi> Charmides, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 135</bibl>; cf. decharmido.</sense></entryFree>
