charon: <entryFree id="n7752" type="main" key="Cha^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăron</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype> (ōnis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 1</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xa/rwn</foreign>. <sense id="n7752.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Charon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ferryman in the Lower World</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 17, 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 299</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 771" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 771</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n7752.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chărōnēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Charon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the Lower World</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scrobes,</quote> <trans><tr>deep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:208" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 93, 95, § 208</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7752.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Theban</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Pelop. 2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Pelop. 2, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charondas: <entryFree id="n7753" type="main" key="Cha^ro_ndas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chărōndas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xarw/ndas</foreign>, <sense id="n7753.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished lawgiver in Catana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:22:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 22, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charta: <entryFree id="n7754" type="greek" key="charta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">charta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">chartus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 196, 19</bibl>). <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">o/ xa/rths</foreign> (cf. the letter A), <sense id="n7754.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a leaf of the Egyptian papyrus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 21, § 68</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 113</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dentata,</quote> <trans><tr>smooth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 14</bibl></cit> (15), 1: <cit><quote lang="la">emporitica inutilis scribendo involucris chartarum segestriumque mercibus usum praebet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 23, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulares,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 11</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:9:3:section=10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 9, 3, § 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">novae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37:11:4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 37, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">purae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:1:52:section=4" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 32, 1, 52, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:10:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 10, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7754.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7754.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The papyrus plant itse</hi>'<hi rend="ital">f</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 11, 21, § 68</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n7754.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">That which is written upon paper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">letter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">poem</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:971" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 971</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:17:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 17, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 20, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:46" default="NO" valid="yes">68, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 161</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 270</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 310</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arpinae, i.e. Ciceronis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 19</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n7754.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a thin leaf</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lamina</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tablet</hi> (cf. Lidd. and Scott, under <foreign lang="greek">xa/rths</foreign>, 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">plumbea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chartaceus: <entryFree id="n7755" type="main" key="charta_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chartācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>charta</etym>, <sense id="n7755.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of paper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paper-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">codices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:32:50" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 32, 50</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chartarius: <entryFree id="n7756" type="main" key="charta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chartārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7756.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <pb n="326" /> <cb n="CHEL" /> <hi rend="ital">pertaining to paper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paper-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">officinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 10, 20, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calamus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n7756.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chartārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a papermerchant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 313</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4159</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7756.2" n="III" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">chartārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">archives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> adv. Ruf. 3, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
charteus: <entryFree id="n7757" type="main" key="charte^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chartĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>charta</etym>, <sense id="n7757.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to paper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">paper-</hi> (ante- and postclass.): stadium, <hi rend="ital">occupation in writing</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 248, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supellex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 40</bibl></cit>: pulvis, id. Praef. ad Griph.</sense></entryFree>
chartiaticum:
<entryFree id="n7758" type="greek" key="charti^a_ti^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chartĭātĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xartiatiko/n</foreign>, <sense id="n7758.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">money for paper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:20:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 20, 6</bibl> (others, charisticum, gift, present).
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">chartŏphylax</orth>, <itype>ăcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xartofu/lac</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a keeper of archives</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 587, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chartopola: <entryFree id="n7759" type="greek" key="charto^po_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chartŏpōla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xartopw/lhs</foreign>, <sense id="n7759.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a paper-merchant</hi>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:27" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chartula: <entryFree id="n7760" type="main" key="chartu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chartŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>charta</etym>, <sense id="n7760.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little paper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a small writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a bill</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 18, 2</bibl>; Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 2, 77</bibl>; Fronto ad Amic. 1, 15; Cod. Th. 8, 2, 2 al.</sense></entryFree>
chartularius: <entryFree id="n7761" type="main" key="chartu^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chartŭlārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>chartula</etym>; in late Lat., <sense id="n7761.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a keeper of the archives of court</hi>, Cod. Th. 8, 1, 6 al.</sense></entryFree>
chartus: <entryFree id="n7762" type="main" key="chartus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chartus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. charta <sense id="n7762.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
charybdis: <entryFree id="n7763" type="main" key="Cha^rybdis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chărybdis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xa/rubdis</foreign>, <sense id="n7763.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dangerous whirlpool between Italy and Sicily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite to Scylla</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Calofaro;</hi> personified, <hi rend="ital">a monstrous female being</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:14" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 8, 14, § 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vasta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:723" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 723</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 26, 54: <cit><quote lang="la">implacata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:420" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 420</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Austro agitata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irrequieta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:13:730" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 730</bibl></cit>; <case>acc.</case> Charybdin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 75</bibl>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Charybdim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:56:section=146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 56, § 146</bibl></cit> Zumpt <hi rend="ital">N. cr.; abl.</hi> Charybdi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:17" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 17</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7763.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">any thing dangerous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destructive</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Charybdim bonorum voraginem potius (dixerim),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 163</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chasma: <entryFree id="n7764" type="greek" key="chasma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chasma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xa/sma</foreign>, <sense id="n7764.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an opening of the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chasm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abyss</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 6:9:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 6, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:11" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:15:4" default="NO">50, 15, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:6:10" default="NO">18, 6, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7764.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of meteor</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt chasmata, cum aliquod caeli spatium desedit et flammam velut dehiscens in abdito ostentat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 14, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 26, 26, § 96</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 9, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chasmatias: <entryFree id="n7765" type="greek" key="chasma^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chasmătĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xasmati/as</foreign>, <sense id="n7765.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an earthquake which leaves chasms</hi> or <hi rend="ital">openings</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 13</bibl>; App. de Mundo, 65, 25, Bip. 2, p. 264.</sense></entryFree>
chasuarii: <entryFree id="n7766" type="main" key="Chasu^a_ri^i"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chasŭārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7766.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German tribe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 34</bibl> Orell.; cf. Attuarii.</sense></entryFree>
chatti: <entryFree id="n7767" type="main" key="Chatti"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chatti</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Catti</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xa/ttoi</foreign>, Strab., <sense id="n7767.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people in the present Hesse</hi> (which name is formed from Chatti) <hi rend="ital">and Thuringia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl> Rup.; 31 sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:55 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 55 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 14, 28, § 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:147 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 147 al.</bibl>—In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chatta mulier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chauci: <entryFree id="n7768" type="main" key="Chauci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chauci</orth> (in MSS. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chauchi</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cauci</orth>; cf. upon the signif. and orthog. of the word, Rup. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 35</bibl>; poët. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăūci</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chăȳci</orth>, trisyl., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 463</bibl>; Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 379</bibl>; and in <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Căȳco</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 225</bibl>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kau=xoi</foreign>, Ptolem.; <foreign lang="greek">*kau=koi</foreign>, Strab., <sense id="n7768.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people in Lower Germany</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the ocean</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from the Ems to the Elbe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the south to the region of Oldenburg and Bremen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided into</hi> majores and minores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:106:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 106, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 79</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 24, 28, § 99</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">on account of his conquest of them, Gabinius Secundus received the cognomen Chaucius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 24</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chele: <entryFree id="n7769" type="greek" key="che_le_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chēlē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xhlh/</foreign> (the claws or arms of animals). * <sense id="n7769.0" n="I" level="1"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">the claw-shaped part of the ballista</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the trigger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manicula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 15</bibl></cit> and 17.—</sense><sense id="n7769.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chēlae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; in astron., lit. <hi rend="ital">the arms of Scorpio;</hi> but, since these extend into Libra, meton. <hi rend="ital">Libra</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=293" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 293</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:56" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:659" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 659</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 203</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 120</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelidon: <entryFree id="n7770" type="main" key="Che^li_don"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chĕlīdon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xelidw/n</foreign>, <sense id="n7770.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female client of Verres who made him her heir</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:40:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 40, § 104</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 1, 52, § 137</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
chelidoniacus: <entryFree id="n7771" type="greek" key="che^li_do^ni^a^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlīdŏnĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xelidoniako/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7771.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pointed like a swallow</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s tail</hi>: gladius. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 18, 6, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelidoniae: <entryFree id="n7772" type="main" key="Che^li_do^ni^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chĕlīdŏnĭae Insŭlae</orth>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xelido/neai<cb n="CHER" />  (-do/niai) *nh=soi</foreign>, <sense id="n7772.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Swallow-islands</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a group of three</hi> or <hi rend="ital">five small</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rocky islands off the Lycian coast</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:20:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 20, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelidonias: <entryFree id="n7773" type="greek" key="che^li_do^ni^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlīdŏnĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xelidoni/as</foreign> (pertaining to the swallow), <sense id="n7773.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the west wind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blowing after the</hi> 22<hi rend="ital">d of Feb.</hi> (after the arrival of the swallows), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 122</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelidonius: <entryFree id="n7774" type="greek" key="che^li_do^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlīdŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xelido/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n7774.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the swallow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapilli,</quote> <trans><tr>found in the crop of young swallows</tr>, <tr>swallow-stone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 79, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus,</quote> <trans><tr>a particular reddish species of fig</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:415" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 415</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 18, 19, § 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7774.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlīdŏnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba): Chelidonium majus, Linn.; <hi rend="ital">swallowwort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celandine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:8:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 50</bibl>, §§ 89 and 90; also herba chelidoniae in <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 37, 699</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelonia: <entryFree id="n7775" type="greek" key="che^lo_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xelwni/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7775.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tortoise - stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelonitis: <entryFree id="n7776" type="greek" key="che^lo_ni_tis1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlōnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xelwii=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7776.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone like the tortoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 155</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 15, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7777" type="main" key="Che^lo_ni_tis2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chĕlōnītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xelwni=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7777.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Arabian Gulf</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 32, § 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelonium: <entryFree id="n7778" type="greek" key="che^lo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlōnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xelw/nion</foreign> (lit. <sense id="n7778.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tortoise-shell;</hi> hence); in mechanics, <hi rend="ital">the similarly formed shield</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cramp</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">stay in which the axis of the crane</hi> or <hi rend="ital">windlass moved</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 8</bibl>; 10, 15; 10, 18; 10, 21.—</sense><sense id="n7778.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> cyclaminos, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelydrus: <entryFree id="n7779" type="greek" key="che^ly_^drus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlȳ^drus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xe/ludros</foreign>, <sense id="n7779.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fetid serpent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">living</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for the most part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:415" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 415</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 272</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 710</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:316" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 316</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:496" default="NO">8, 496</bibl>; Prud. c. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:130" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 1, 130</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelyon: <entryFree id="n7780" type="greek" key="che^ly^on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlyon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xe/luon</foreign>, <sense id="n7780.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the shell of the horned tortoise</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 173</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 10, 12, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chelys: <entryFree id="n7781" type="greek" key="che^lys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕlys</orth>, <case>acc.</case> chelyn, <case>voc.</case> chely (other cases apparently not in use), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xe/lus</foreign>. <sense id="n7781.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The tortoise</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> Fragm. 32, 5</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7781.1" n="II" level="1"> As in Greek (cf. Lidd. and Scott in h. v.), <hi rend="ital">a lyre</hi> or <hi rend="ital">harp made of its shell</hi>, pure Lat. testudo (except Ovid, in post-Aug. poets only; <cit><quote lang="la">most freq. in Statius): chelys,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 4, 33</bibl>; Claud. III. Cons. Hon. praef. 18; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 313</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 123</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 455</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chelyn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 181</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:11" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 120</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 30</bibl>; 4, 8, 38; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:366" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 6, 366</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 325" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 325</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1034" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Oet. 1034</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2</bibl>, praef. 8: <cit><quote lang="la">chely,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:119" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7781.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The constellation Lyra</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 617</bibl> and 631.</sense></entryFree>
chema: <entryFree id="n7782" type="greek" key="che_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chēma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xh/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n7782.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gaping mussel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cockle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 53, § 147</bibl> Jan. (al. leg. chama).</sense></entryFree>
cheme: <entryFree id="n7783" type="greek" key="che_me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chēmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xh/mh</foreign>, <sense id="n7783.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measure for liquids</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the third part of a</hi> mystrum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Rhem. Fan.</author> Pond. 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chenalopeces: <entryFree id="n7784" type="greek" key="che_na^lo_pe^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chēnălōpĕces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xhnalw/pekes</foreign>, <sense id="n7784.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of goose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duck</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 29, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chenerotes: <entryFree id="n7785" type="greek" key="che_ne^ro_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chēnĕrōtes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (* <foreign lang="greek">xhne/rws</foreign>), <sense id="n7785.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of small goose</hi> or <hi rend="ital">duck;</hi> perh. Anas clipeata, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 29, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cheniscus: <entryFree id="n7786" type="greek" key="che_niscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chēniscus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, = <foreign lang="greek">xhni/skos</foreign>, lit. <sense id="n7786.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gosling;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">the ornament in the form of a goose on a ship</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s stern</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 264, 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chenoboscion: <entryFree id="n7787" type="greek" key="che_no^bosci_on"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chēnŏboscīon</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xhnoboskei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n7787.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pen for geese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:14:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 14, 1</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 3, 10, 1</bibl>, written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
chenomyche: <entryFree id="n7788" type="greek" key="che_no^my^che_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chēnŏmychē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xhnomu/xh</foreign>, <sense id="n7788.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, = nyctegreton and nyctalops, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 11, 36, § 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cheragra: <entryFree id="n7789" type="main" key="che^ra_gra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕrāgra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. chiragra.</entryFree>
chernites: <entryFree id="n7790" type="greek" key="cherni_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chernītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xerni/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n7790.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of marble resembling ivory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 17, 28, § 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cherronesus: <entryFree id="n7791" type="main" key="Cherro^ne_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cherrŏnēsus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-ŏs</orth>), or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chersŏnē-sus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xerro/nhsos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*xerso/nhsos</foreign> (a peninsula; hence), <sense id="n7791.0" n="I" level="1"> Cherronesus Thracia, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Cherronesus, <hi rend="ital">the Thracian peninsula at the west of the Hellespont</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the Chersonese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:35:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 35, 86</bibl> B. and K.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1, 1 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 16, 5</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cherrŏnenses</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chersŏ-nenses</orth> (contr. instead of Cherronesenses), <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of the Chersonese</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 1, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7791.1" n="II" level="1"> Cherronesus Taurica, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Cherronesus, <hi rend="ital">the Crimea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 19</bibl>; <cb n="CHIM" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 26, § 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:95" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 5, 30, § 95</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7791.2" n="III" level="1"> Cherronesus Heracleotarum, or Heraclea, <hi rend="ital">a town on the western side of the Crimea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:85" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 12, 26, § 85</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7791.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A promontory in Argolis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from Trœzene</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Chersonisi</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:3:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 3, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7791.4" n="V" level="1"> Cherronesus Rhodiorum, <hi rend="ital">a small promontory of Caria opposite Rhodes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on which the town of Cnidus stands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 2, 20, § 30</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7791.5" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A small town on the Egyptian coast</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 10.</sense></entryFree>
chersinus: <entryFree id="n7792" type="greek" key="chersi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chersĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xe/rsinos</foreign>, <sense id="n7792.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">living upon dry land</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">testudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 38</bibl></cit> (in Mart 14, 88, called chersos = <foreign lang="greek">xe/rsos</foreign>.)</sense></entryFree>
chersonesus: <entryFree id="n7793" type="main" key="Cherso^ne_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chersŏnēsus</orth>, v. Cherronesus.</entryFree>
chersos: <entryFree id="n7794" type="greek" key="chersos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chersos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xe/rsos</foreign>, dry land</etym>, <sense id="n7794.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of toad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">feminea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:88" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chersydros: <entryFree id="n7795" type="greek" key="chersy_^dros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chersȳ^dros</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xe/rsudros</foreign>, <sense id="n7795.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an amphibious serpent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:711" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 711</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 415</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cherub: <entryFree id="n7796" type="main" key="Che^rub"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chĕrub</orth>, <gen>m.</gen> <number>plur.</number> Chĕrūbĭm (Cherubin), <foreign />, <number>plur.</number> <foreign />, <sense id="n7796.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a rank of angels mentioned in the Old Testament</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Gen. 3, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 4, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Ezech. 9</bibl> and 28; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 7, 5, 22 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 3, 4</bibl>; Ven. Fort. Carm. 7, 3, 131.</sense></entryFree>
cherusci: <entryFree id="n7797" type="main" key="Che_^rusci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chē^rusci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xhrou=skoi</foreign>. Strabo; <foreign lang="greek">*xerouskoi</foreign>, Dio.; <foreign lang="greek">*xairouskoi/</foreign>, Ptolem.; in a more restricted sense, <sense id="n7797.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a German people on the south side of the Hartz Mountains;</hi> but more freq. in an extended sense, <hi rend="ital">the combined German tribes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which became distinguished by their war with the Romans</hi>, <hi rend="ital">living on both sides of the Weser and Lippe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:105" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 105</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:117" default="NO">2, 117</bibl> sqq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 36</bibl> Rup.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 56</bibl> sq.; 2, 9 sq.; 12, 28 et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:24" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> IV. Cons. Hon. 452</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> B. Get. 420</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chesippus: <entryFree id="n7798" type="main" key="Chesippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chesippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7798.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a contemptuous name given by Zeno to Chrysippus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 93</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chiliarches: <entryFree id="n7799" type="main" key="chi_li^arche_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīlĭarchēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">chīlĭarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xilia/rxhs</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">xili/arxos</foreign>, <sense id="n7799.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a commander of</hi> 1000 <hi rend="ital">soldiers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chiliarch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5</bibl>. 2, 2. Also in gen., <hi rend="ital">a head of</hi> 1000 <hi rend="ital">persons</hi>, Cod. Th. 16, 10, 20, § 4.—</sense><sense id="n7799.1" n="II" level="1"> Among the Persians, <hi rend="ital">the highest officer of state next to the king</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chancellor of state</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,009:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Con. 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chilias: <entryFree id="n7800" type="greek" key="chi_li^a^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīlĭăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xilia/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7800.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the number</hi> 1000, <hi rend="ital">a chiliad</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chiliastae: <entryFree id="n7801" type="greek" key="chi_li^astae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīlĭastae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xiliastai/</foreign>, <sense id="n7801.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the believers in the millennial kingdom</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 20, 7.</sense></entryFree>
chiliodynama: <entryFree id="n7802" type="greek" key="chi_li^o^dy^na^ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīlĭŏdynăma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xi/lioi-du/namis</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7802.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown medicinal plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thousand-virtues</hi>, = polemonia, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 28, § 64</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chiliophyllon: <entryFree id="n7803" type="greek" key="chi_li^o^phyllon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīlĭŏphyllon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xi/lioi-fu/llon</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7803.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thousand-leaves</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chilius: <entryFree id="n7804" type="main" key="Chi_li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīlĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7804.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek poet</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1</bibl>. 12, 2.</sense></entryFree>
chilo: <entryFree id="n7805" type="gloss" key="Chi_lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7805.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">signifying having large lips</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43, 10</bibl> [<foreign lang="greek">xei=los</foreign>, lip; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 78</bibl> P.; Vel. Long. p. 2234 ib.].</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7806" type="main" key="Chi_lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xi/lwn</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*xei/lwn</foreign>. <sense id="n7806.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Lacedœmonian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">one of the seven wise men</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 32, 32, § 119</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Sept. Sap. 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7806.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 6, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chimaera: <entryFree id="n7807" type="main" key="Chi^maera"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chĭmaera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xi/maira</foreign> (lit. a goat), <sense id="n7807.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabulous monster in Lycia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">which vomited fire; in front a lion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the hinder part a dragon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and in the middle a goat; slain by Bellerophon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:38:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 38, 108</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:903" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 903</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:705" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 705</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:86" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 288</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:27:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 27, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 17, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:7:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 397</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 57" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 5, 118</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 288</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">its figure</hi>, used to adorn a helmet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:785" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 785</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7807.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain in Lycia that sent forth flames</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and is said to have given rise to the preceding fable</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 106, 110, § 236</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 27, 28, § 100</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. A. 6, 288</bibl>.—Deriv., </sense><sense id="n7807.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chĭmaerēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the mountain Chimœra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">liquor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 14</bibl></cit> Wagn.— </sense><sense id="n7807.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the ships of the companions of Æneas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 118</bibl> and 223; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:498" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 498</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chimaerifer: <entryFree id="n7808" type="hapax" key="Chi^maeri^fe^r"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chĭmaerĭfĕr</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Chimaera-fero</etym>: Lycia, <sense id="n7808.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that produced the Chimœra</hi> (cf. Chimaera, l.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:339" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 339</bibl>. <pb n="327" /> <cb n="CHIR" /></sense></entryFree>
chimerinus: <entryFree id="n7809" type="greek" key="chi_me^ri^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīmĕrĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeime/rinos</foreign>, <sense id="n7809.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">winter</hi>: tropa, Kalend. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> II. p. 381</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chione: <entryFree id="n7810" type="main" key="Chi^o^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chĭŏnē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xio/nh</foreign>. <sense id="n7810.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Dœdation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mother of Autolycus by Mercury</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and of the musician Philammon by Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shot by Diana</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:301 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 301 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 200" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 200</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7810.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A daughter of Boreas and Orithyia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and mother of Eumolpus;</hi> hence <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, = Eumolpus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:41" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 41</bibl> dub. (Merkel, Edonides).</sense></entryFree>
chios: <entryFree id="n7811" type="main" key="Chi_^os"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chī^os</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=422" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 422</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xi/os</foreign>, <sense id="n7811.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the coast of Ionia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a capital of the same name</hi>, distinguished in ancient times for its excellent wine and marble, now <hi rend="ital">Scio</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Khio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:48:section=127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 48, § 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr.4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr.4 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7811.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīus</orth> (Chĭus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 251</bibl> and 1179), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xi=os</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Chios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Chian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 3; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Chīa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 136</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 16, 56, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 31, 38, § 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 17, 28, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 1, 79</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:34" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cadus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 5</bibl>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Chium (sc. vinum), <hi rend="ital">Chian wine</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 8, 15</bibl> and 48: <cit><quote lang="la">ficus (also of peculiar excellence),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 6</bibl></cit>; also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> Chia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:414" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 414</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:25" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:23" default="NO">13, 23</bibl>.—Fine cloth also was made at Chios, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1126</bibl>.—The Chians were noted for generous living; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, a puero vitam Chiam gessi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 63, 3</bibl></cit>.—Chius is also a name for <hi rend="ital">the constellation Scorpio</hi>, since, acc. to the fable, Orion was put to death at Chios by Diana by means of a scorpion, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 1136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">251 al.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:422 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 422 sq.</bibl>—In <hi rend="ital">plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Chians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:8:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 8, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:27:5 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 27, 5 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
chiragra: <entryFree id="n7812" type="greek" key="chi_ra_^gra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrā^gra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeira/gra</foreign>, <sense id="n7812.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gout in the hand</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 9 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">podagra et chiragra et omnis vertebrarum dolor nervorumque interquiescit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 78:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 78, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">chĕrā^gra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:99:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 99, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:92:9" default="NO">9, 92, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chiragricus: <entryFree id="n7813" type="main" key="chi_ra_^gri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrā^grĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeiragriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7813.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having the gout in the hand; subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chī-rā^grĭci</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 132, 14</bibl>; rarely <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chiramaxium: <entryFree id="n7814" type="greek" key="chi_ra^maxi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrămaxĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeirama/cion</foreign>, <sense id="n7814.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small carriage drawn by slaves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a handwagon</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 28, 4</bibl> ( = vehiculum manuale, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6:86" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6, 86</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
chiridotus: <entryFree id="n7815" type="greek" key="chi_ri^do_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrĭdōtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeiridwto/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7815.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">furnished with sleeves</hi>, pure Lat. manuleatus or manicatus: tunica, Scip. Afr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>; cf. Gell. ib. § 1 sq.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrĭdōtae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (sc. tunicae), <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chiro: <entryFree id="n7816" type="main" key="Chi_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīro</orth>, v. Chiron.</entryFree>
chirocmeta: <entryFree id="n7817" type="greek" key="Chi_rocme_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīrocmēta</orth>, <itype>ōn or ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeiro/kmhta</foreign> (lit. <sense id="n7817.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made by the hand</hi>), <hi rend="ital">title of a book by Democritus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 160</bibl> (as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9</bibl>, prooem. § 14; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 17</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
chirographarius: <entryFree id="n7818" type="greek" key="chi_ro^gra^pha_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrŏgrăphārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>chirographum</etym>, <sense id="n7818.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to handwriting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">manuscript-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creditores,</quote> <trans><tr>who have the obligation of the debtor in his own handwriting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:38:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 5, 38, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 2, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">debitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8, 27, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chirographum: <entryFree id="n7819" type="greek" key="chi_ro^gra^phum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrŏgrăphum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (access. form * <orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, sc. libellus or codex, Fulvius ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:100" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 100</bibl> Spald., together with chirographum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:ib. 5:13:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> ib. 5, 13, 8</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrŏgrăphon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 16, 56</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">xeiro/grafon</foreign>. <sense id="n7819.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own handwriting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">autograph;</hi> pure Lat. manus (in good prose; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. in Cic.): extrema pagella pupugit me tuo chirographo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; Planc. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 21, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque utar meo chirographo neque signo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:30:74 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 30, 74 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n7819.1" n="II" level="1"> Meton (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">that which is written with one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own hand</hi>: credidi chirographis ejus (<hi rend="ital">assurances in his own handwriting</hi>), Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 21, 1</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:80:277" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 80, 277</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 1, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:73" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7819.2" n="B" level="2"> In the lang. of business, t. t., <hi rend="ital">a bond</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surety</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">obligation under one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s own hand</hi> (diff. from syngrapha, q. v.; not found with this <cb n="CHLO" /> meaning in Cic.), Gai <bibl default="NO"><author>Inst.</author> 3, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:20:1:26" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 20, 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:14:3" default="NO">49, 14, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:2:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 2, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chiron: <entryFree id="n7820" type="main" key="Chi_ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīron</orth> (<case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīro</orth>, Liv. Andron. ap. Fest. s. v. ocrem, p. 181), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xei/rwn</foreign>, <sense id="n7820.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Centaurs</hi>, distinguished for his knowledge of plants, medicine, and divination, <hi rend="ital">son of Saturn and Philyra</hi> (hence, Philyrides Chiron, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 550</bibl>), the tutor of Æsculapius (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:630 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 630 sq.</bibl>), Hercules, Achilles, Jason, etc.; at last translated to heaven as a constellation, Hyg. Praef. and Fab. 274; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Astr. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 3, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 550</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 270</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Chirona, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 126</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">a constellation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:536" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 536</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7820.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7820.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīrō-nīus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">named after Chiron</hi> (the physician and botanist).—So <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrōnīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (sc. herba), <hi rend="ital">a name</hi> of several plants: <cit><quote lang="la">pyxacanthos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 14, 77, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panaces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 4, 13, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ampelos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 4, 16, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis nigra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 1, 17, § 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chironium vulnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 22</bibl>: Chironion, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, i. q. Centaurion, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 31, § 66</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n7820.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīrōnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Chiron</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
chironomia: <entryFree id="n7821" type="greek" key="chi_ro^no^mi_^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrŏnŏmī^a</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeironomi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7821.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the art of moving the hands in gesturing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gesticulation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chironomia, quae est lex gestūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chironomos: <entryFree id="n7822" type="greek" key="chi_ro^no^mo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrŏnŏmŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrŏ-nŏmōn</orth>, <itype>ontis</itype> (also Gr. untis), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeirono/mos</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">xeironomw=n</foreign>, <sense id="n7822.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who moves his hands according to the rules of art</hi>, <hi rend="ital">correctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pantomime</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:63" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:121" default="NO">5, 121</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
chirurgia: <entryFree id="n7823" type="greek" key="chi_rurgi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrurgĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeirourgi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7823.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">surgery</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 200" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 200</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 13, 1</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n7823.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a violent remedy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chirurgiae taedet, i. e. vim et arma detestor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chirurgicus: <entryFree id="n7824" type="greek" key="chi_rurgi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrurgĭcus</orth>, <itype>a um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeirourgiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7824.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">surgical</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chirurgical</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">medicina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 274" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 274</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chirurgumena: <entryFree id="n7825" type="greek" key="Chi_rurgu_me^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chīrurgūmĕna</orth>, <itype>ōn</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xeirourgou/mena</foreign>, <sense id="n7825.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Surgical Operations</hi>, title of a book, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:146" default="NO">2, 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chirurgus: <entryFree id="n7826" type="greek" key="chi_rurgus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chīrurgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">xeirourgo/s</foreign>, = <sense id="n7826.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surgeon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chirurgeon</hi> (pure Lat. medicus vulnerarius), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7 praef.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:31" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 201" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 201</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:209 al" default="NO">209 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 38</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4228 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
chius: <entryFree id="n7827" type="main" key="Chius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Chios.</entryFree>
chlamyda: <entryFree id="n7828" type="main" key="chla^my^da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chlămyda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. chlamys.</entryFree>
chlamydatus: <entryFree id="n7829" type="main" key="chla^my^da_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chlămydātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>chlamys</etym>, <sense id="n7829.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dressed in a military cloak</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 9 al.</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:6:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 6, 2</bibl> and 3.</sense></entryFree>
chlamys: <entryFree id="n7830" type="greek" key="chla^mys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chlămys</orth>, <itype>ydis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">chlămyda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, as cassida = cassis, al., <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 253, 31</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, p. 269, 11; and perh. Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 539, 9</bibl>, where, however, chlamyda may be <case>acc.</case> Gr. from chlamys), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xlamu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7830.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a broad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">woollen upper garment worn in Greece</hi>, sometimes purple, and inwrought with gold, worn esp. by distinguished milit. characters, <hi rend="ital">a Grecian military cloak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a state mantle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:5:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 5, 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 5, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:4:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 2, 4, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 250</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 582</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 775</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 51</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 345</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 393</bibl>.—Hence also, <hi rend="ital">the cloak of Pallas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:588" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 588</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl>.—Sometimes also worn by persons not engaged in war, e. g. by Mercury, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:733" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 733</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">by Dido,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 137</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">by Agrippina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 56</bibl></cit> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 19, § 63</bibl>, instead of it, paludamentum); <cit><quote lang="la">by children,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:484" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 484</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:5:2:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 5, 2, 69</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">by actors,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">by the chorus in tragedy,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 40</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chloe: <entryFree id="n7831" type="main" key="Chlo^e_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chlŏē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xlo/h</foreign>, <sense id="n7831.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Greek female name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chlora: <entryFree id="n7832" type="main" key="chlora"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chlora</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7832.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a medicament</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 28, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chloreus: <entryFree id="n7833" type="greek" key="chlo_reus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chlōreus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ei</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xlwreu/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7833.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a greenish bird</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 95, § 203</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chlorion: <entryFree id="n7834" type="greek" key="chlo_ri^o_n"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chlōrĭōn</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xlwri/wn</foreign>, <sense id="n7834.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a yellow bird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the yellow thrush;</hi> acc. to Cuvier, <hi rend="ital">the oriole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 45, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:292" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 29, 69, § 292</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chloris: <entryFree id="n7835" type="main" key="Chlo_ri^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chlōrĭs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xlw=ris</foreign> (greenness) = Flora, <sense id="n7835.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess of flowers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:195" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 20, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7835.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The daughter of Amphion and Niobe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wife of Neleus</hi>, Hyg. <cb n="CHOR" /> Fab. 10.—</sense><sense id="n7835.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek female name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 15, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chloritis: <entryFree id="n7836" type="greek" key="chlo_ri_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chlōrītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xlwri=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n7836.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a grass-green color</hi>, perhaps <hi rend="ital">the smaragdoprasus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chlorus: <entryFree id="n7837" type="main" key="Chlorus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chlorus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n7837.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river of Cilicia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 91</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7837.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cognomen of Sex. Pompeius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:8:section=23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 8, § 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choaspes: <entryFree id="n7838" type="main" key="Cho^aspes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chŏaspes</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Chŏaspis</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 13, 21, 15</bibl>), <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xoa/sphs</foreign>. <sense id="n7838.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Susiana</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for its pure water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from which the Persian kings drank</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kerrah</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Kerkhah</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Kara-su</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 27, 31, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:35" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 3, 21, § 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">regia lympha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:140" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 140</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:2:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 2, 9</bibl>.—Personified, as <hi rend="ital">a river-god</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:584" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 584</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7838.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in India</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kabul</hi> (acc. to others, <hi rend="ital">the Attok</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:22" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
