choaspitis: <entryFree id="n7839" type="main" key="cho^aspi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏaspītis</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">-pītes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 7, 16</bibl>), <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Choaspes</etym>, <sense id="n7839.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stor found in the Choaspes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choatrae: <entryFree id="n7840" type="main" key="Cho^a_trae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chŏātrae</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏātr-</orth>; al. <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cŏastr-</orth>), <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7840.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Lake Mœotis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 7, 7, § 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:246" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 246</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:151" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 151</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choatras: <entryFree id="n7841" type="main" key="Cho^a_tras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chŏātras</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xoa/tras</foreign>, <sense id="n7841.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain in Media</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choatres: <entryFree id="n7842" type="main" key="Cho^a_tres"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chŏātres</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xoa/qras</foreign>, <sense id="n7842.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Parthia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">the Adschi-Su</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choenix: <entryFree id="n7843" type="greek" key="choenix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">choenix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">choenĭca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Nov. 20, 1</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52</bibl> Müll.), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xoi=nic</foreign>, <sense id="n7843.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Attic measure for grain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">containing</hi> 2 sextarii, Fann. Pond. 68.</sense></entryFree>
choeras: <entryFree id="n7844" type="greek" key="choera^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">choerăs</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xoira/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7844.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scrofula</hi> (pure Lat. struma), <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 2</bibl>, n. 10.</sense></entryFree>
choerilus: <entryFree id="n7845" type="main" key="Choeri^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Choerĭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xoiri/los</foreign>, <sense id="n7845.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wretched Greek poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the train of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 233</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 357</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 16, 3</bibl>.—After him, or another poet of the same name (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 232</bibl>), is named <orth extent="full" lang="la">Choerĭlīum</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-ēum</orth>) <itype>metrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a dactylic species of verse</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1820</bibl> P.; Victorin. p. 2558 ib.</sense></entryFree>
choerogryllus: <entryFree id="n7846" type="main" key="choerogryllus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">choerogryllus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xoiro/grullos</foreign>, <sense id="n7846.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of hare</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 14, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choicus: <entryFree id="n7847" type="greek" key="cho^i^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xoi+ko/s</foreign>. <sense id="n7847.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of earth</hi> or <hi rend="ital">clay</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Anim. 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Res Carn. 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cholas: <entryFree id="n7848" type="greek" key="cholas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cholas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7848.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of emerald</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 18, § 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cholera: <entryFree id="n7849" type="greek" key="cho^le^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏlĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xole/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n7849.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the jaundice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:11 al" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 93, § 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:120" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 13, 73, § 120</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 48, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:146 al" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 14, 52, § 146 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cholericus: <entryFree id="n7850" type="greek" key="cho^le^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏlĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xoleriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7850.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">bilious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jaundiced</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 13, 72, § 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 256" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 256</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choliambus: <entryFree id="n7851" type="greek" key="cho_li^ambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chōlĭambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xwli/ambos</foreign> (the limping iambus), <sense id="n7851.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">iambic verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose last foot</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instead of an iambus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is a spondee</hi> or <hi rend="ital">trochee</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 503</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
choma: <entryFree id="n7852" type="greek" key="cho_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xw=ma</foreign>, <sense id="n7852.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dam</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bank</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">mound</hi> (pure Lat. agger), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:11:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 11, 10</bibl>; Cod. Th. 11, 24, 6, § 7.</sense></entryFree>
chondrille: <entryFree id="n7853" type="main" key="chondrille_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chondrillē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">chondryllē</orth>), <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">chondrillon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xondri/llh</foreign>, <sense id="n7853.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chondrilla</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Spanish succory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 15, 52, § 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:91" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 22, 45, § 91</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chondris: <entryFree id="n7854" type="greek" key="chondris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chondris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7854.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of horehound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resembling marjoram</hi>: Marrubium pseudodictamnus, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 8, 53, § 92</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:49" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 8, 31, § 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chora: <entryFree id="n7855" type="main" key="Cho_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chōra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xw/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n7855.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a district of Lower Egypt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Alexandria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 42</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:212" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 36, 39, § 212</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choragium: <entryFree id="n7856" type="greek" key="cho^ra_gi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrāgĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xorh/gion</foreign>. <sense id="n7856.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The place where the chorus was trained and practised</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3209</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7856.1" n="II" level="1"> ( = <foreign lang="greek">xorhgi/a</foreign>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Lidd. and Scott),</quote> <trans><tr>the preparing and bringing out of a chorus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:prol. 61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. prol. 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 282, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=52" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 52</bibl>; in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:4:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 4, 6</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n7856.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">any other splendid preparation</hi> or <hi rend="ital">equipment</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 15, 24, § 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptiarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 157, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funebre,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 123, 25.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gloriae,</quote> <trans><tr>means of acquiring</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 50, 63</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7856.3" n="III" level="1"> In mechanics, <hi rend="ital">a spring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choragus: <entryFree id="n7857" type="greek" key="cho^ra_gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrāgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xorhgo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7857.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who had the care of the chorus and the supplies</hi> <pb n="328" /> <cb n="CHOR" /> <hi rend="ital">necessary for it</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the choragus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:1:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 1, 3, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 4, 1</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7857.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">he who pays the cost of a banquet</hi>, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:70" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 70</bibl> Ruhnk.</sense></entryFree>
choraula: <entryFree id="n7858" type="main" key="cho^raula"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏraula</orth>, v. choraules.</entryFree>
choraule: <entryFree id="n7859" type="gloss" key="cho^raule_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏraulē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xorau/lh</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7859.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female flute-player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who accompanied with the flute the chorus dance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2610</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choraules: <entryFree id="n7860" type="greek" key="cho^raules"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏraules</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (<case>acc.</case> choraulen, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 1, 3, § 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <sense id="n7860.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">choraulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 54</bibl></cit>; a <case>nom.</case> choraula is apparently found only in the later glossaries), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xorau/lhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a flute-player</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who accompanied with a flute the chorus dance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:56:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 56, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:78" default="NO">9, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:77" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2609</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 489</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
choraulicus: <entryFree id="n7861" type="main" key="cho^rauli^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏraulĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>choraules</etym>, <sense id="n7861.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the flute-players of the chorus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 489</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
chorda: <entryFree id="n7862" type="greek" key="chorda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chorda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xordh/</foreign>. * <sense id="n7862.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An intestine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as food</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 66, 7</bibl> (al. leg. cord.).— Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n7862.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Catgut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a string</hi> (<hi rend="ital">of a musical instrument</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:214" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:59:149" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 59, 149 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:412" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 412</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:505" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 505</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:3" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:70" default="NO">3, 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:348 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 348 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7862.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A rope</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cord</hi>, for binding a slave: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc tibi actutum chorda tenditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 55</bibl></cit> Lorenz.</sense></entryFree>
chordacista: <entryFree id="n7863" type="hapax" key="chorda^cista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chordăcista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>chorda</etym>, <sense id="n7863.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player on a stringed instrument</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 924</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chordapsus: <entryFree id="n7864" type="main" key="chordapsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chordapsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xo/rdayos</foreign>, <sense id="n7864.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disease of the intestines</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:17:144" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 17, 144</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 4, 8</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 14</bibl> written as Greek).</sense></entryFree>
chordus: <entryFree id="n7865" type="main" key="chordus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chordus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cordus</orth>, <sense id="n7865.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> the letter <ref targOrder="U">C</ref></xr>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>a very ancient word relating to husbandry, of unknown etym.</etym>, <hi rend="ital">lateborn</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">produced late in the season</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicuntur agni chordi, qui post tempus nascuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:29" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 47, 72, § 187</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:2:5" default="NO">2, 2, 5</bibl>: faenum, <hi rend="ital">the second crop of hay</hi> or <hi rend="ital">after-math</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 28, 67, § 262</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:13:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: frumenta, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=65:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 65, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7866" type="main" key="Chordus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chordus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7866.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen;</hi> esp.: <cit><quote lang="la">H. Cremutius Chordus,</quote> <trans><tr>an historian of the times of Augustus and Tiberius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:4:25" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 4, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 1, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chorea: <entryFree id="n7867" type="main" key="cho^re_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrēa</orth> (chŏrĕa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:59" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 19, 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:644" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 644</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xorei/a</foreign> (most freq. in <number>plur.</number>), <sense id="n7867.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dance in a ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dance.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7867.1" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 636</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7867.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:49" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO">3</bibl> (4), 10, 23; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:615" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 615</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 224</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 581</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 746</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 520</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n7867.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, of <hi rend="ital">the circular motions of the stars</hi>: choreae astricae, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 451, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 668</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chorepiscopus: <entryFree id="n7868" type="greek" key="cho_re^pisco^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chōrĕpiscŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xwrepi/skopos</foreign>, <sense id="n7868.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a deputy of a bishop for a village</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a suffragan bishop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 42</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
choreus: <entryFree id="n7869" type="greek" key="cho^re_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrēus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-īus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xorei=os</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">pou/s</foreign>, pes), in verse, <sense id="n7869.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A foot</hi>, later called trochaeus,—˘, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:212" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 63, 212</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:82" default="NO">9, 4, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:96" default="NO">9, 4, 96</bibl>; Marc. Vict. p. 2487 P.—</sense><sense id="n7869.1" n="II" level="1"> In later metrists, for the earlier tribrachys, ˘˘˘, Diom. pp. 261 and 475 P.</sense></entryFree>
choriambicus: <entryFree id="n7870" type="main" key="cho^ri^ambi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrĭambĭcus</orth>, v. choriambus.</entryFree>
choriambus: <entryFree id="n7871" type="greek" key="cho^ri^ambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrĭambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xori/ambos</foreign>, in verse, <sense id="n7871.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a foot composed of a choreus and an iambus</hi>,—˘˘—, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 478</bibl> P.; Marc. Vict. p. 2490 ib. al.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">choriambum carmen,</quote> <trans><tr>consisting of the choriambus</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10, 37</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrĭambĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">choriambic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metrum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 509</bibl></cit> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1822</bibl> ib.: <cit><quote lang="la">versus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
choricus: <entryFree id="n7872" type="greek" key="cho^ri^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xoriko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7872.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to the chorus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> 3, p. 489</bibl></cit>. —In metre: metrum, <hi rend="ital">a kind of anapœstic verse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consisting of a</hi> hypercatalectic dipody, e. g. animus male fortis, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1821</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
chorius: <entryFree id="n7873" type="main" key="cho^ri_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrīus</orth>, v. choreus.</entryFree>
chorobates: <entryFree id="n7874" type="greek" key="cho_ro^ba^tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chōrŏbătes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xwroba/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n7874.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an instrument for finding the level of water</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a ground-level</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 5, 1</bibl> Schneid.</sense></entryFree>
chorocitharista: <entryFree id="n7875" type="greek" key="cho^ro^ci^tha^rista"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrŏcĭthărista</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xorokiqaristh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7875.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who accompanied the chorus on the cithara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chorographia: <entryFree id="n7876" type="main" key="Cho_ro^gra^phi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chōrŏgrăphĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xwrografi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7876.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the description of countries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">geography</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> ad Stat. Th. 2, 44</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">the title of a book</hi> <cb n="CHRI" /> <hi rend="ital">of Cicero</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 717</bibl> P.; and <hi rend="ital">of a poem of P. Terentius Varro Atacinus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
chorographus: <entryFree id="n7877" type="greek" key="cho_ro^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chōrŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xwrogra/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n7877.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who describes countries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a geographer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl> Schneid. (others read, instead of chorographis, chorographiis, from chorographia, q. v.).</sense></entryFree>
chors: <entryFree id="n7878" type="main" key="chors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chors</orth>, <itype>chortis</itype>, v. cohors.</entryFree>
chortinus: <entryFree id="n7879" type="greek" key="chorti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chortĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xo/rtinos</foreign>, <sense id="n7879.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from grass</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chorus: <entryFree id="n7880" type="greek" key="cho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xoro/s</foreign> [cf. Lidd. and Scott under <foreign lang="greek">xoro/s</foreign>]. <sense id="n7880.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A dance in a ring</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a choral dance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dance</hi>, = chorea: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus et cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:44" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 6, 70: <cit><quote lang="la">Nympharum leves chori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferre pedem choris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:56" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">choros agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:18" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:533" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 533</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 7, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 499</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 737</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instaurare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 4, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 148</bibl></cit> sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">celebrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 594" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 594</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 367" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 367</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:44" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7880.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">The harmonious motions of the heavenly bodies</hi> (cf. chorea), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:88" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 88</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7880.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">a troop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">band of dancers and singers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a chorus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choir</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltatores, citharistas, totum denique comissationis Antonianae chorum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phoebi chorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 5, 20; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,002:75" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> C. S. 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus Dryadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:460" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 460</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nereidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Idaei chori,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pierius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:163" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 163</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:685" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 685</bibl>.—Of the chorus in tragedy: <cit><quote lang="la">actoris partes chorus officiumque virile Defendat, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 193</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 283</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:10:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 10, 12</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7880.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The heavenly bodies moving in harmony</hi> (cf. supra, I. b.): <cit><quote lang="la">Pleiadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 5, 36; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">astrorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Achill. 1, 643</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7880.4" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a multitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">band</hi>, <hi rend="ital">troop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crowd</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">philosophorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 8, 1</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puellarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(piscium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Agam. 452" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Agam. 452</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:33:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 33, 116</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:5:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 5, 13</bibl> (hence, Engl. choir, quire; Fr. choeur; Ital. coro).</sense></entryFree>
chremes: <entryFree id="n7881" type="main" key="Chre^mes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrĕmes</orth>, <itype>ētis or is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xre/mhs</foreign>, <sense id="n7881.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of an old miser in the Andria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Heaut.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and Phormio of Terence</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:9:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 9, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 33</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Chremi, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 2, 31</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Chremeta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 40</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Chreme, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 1, 11 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chremes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>; <case>dat.</case> Chremeti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:8:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 5, 8, 37</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Chremen, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chremem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 2, 2, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Chremetem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chrestologus: <entryFree id="n7882" type="greek" key="Chresto^lo^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrestŏlŏgus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrhstolo/gos</foreign> (well speaking, but ill working), <sense id="n7882.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nickname of the emperor Pertinax</hi>, Capit. Pert. 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. 18" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chreston: <entryFree id="n7883" type="greek" key="chreston"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chreston</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrhsto/n</foreign> (useful), <sense id="n7883.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name by which the plant</hi> cichorium <hi rend="ital">was sometimes called</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 30, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrestus: <entryFree id="n7884" type="main" key="Chrestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrestus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n7884.0" n="I" level="1"> A mutilated form for Christus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 7, 5</bibl>; hence, Chrestiani, instead of Christiani, was used by many; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7884.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Jew at Rome under the emperor Claudius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>; v. the commentt. in h. l.—</sense><sense id="n7884.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave</hi> or <hi rend="ital">freedman of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chria: <entryFree id="n7885" type="greek" key="chri_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrei/a</foreign>, in rhetoric, <sense id="n7885.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sentence proposed as a theme for rhetorical exercise</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with its logical development</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 3 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:4" default="NO">1, 9, 4</bibl> sq.; 2, 4, 26 Spald.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 33:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 33, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 289</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
chrisma: <entryFree id="n7886" type="greek" key="chrisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xri/sma</foreign>, in eccl. Lat., <sense id="n7886.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an anointing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 6, 128</bibl>; Psych. 361 al.</sense></entryFree>
christiane: <entryFree id="n7887" type="main" key="Christi^a_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭānē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. Christianus.</entryFree>
christianismus: <entryFree id="n7888" type="main" key="Christi^a_nismus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭānismus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xristianismo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7888.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Christianity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 33</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 19, 23, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Gal. 6, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
christianitas: <entryFree id="n7889" type="main" key="Christi^a_ni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭānĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>Christus</etym>. <sense id="n7889.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Christianity</hi>, = Christianismus, Cod. Th. 16, 7, 7; 12, 1, 112.—</sense><sense id="n7889.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Christian clergy</hi>, Cod. Th. 12, 1, 123.</sense></entryFree>
christianizo: <entryFree id="n7890" type="greek" key="Christi^a_ni_zo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭānīzo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xristiani/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n7890.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to profess Christianity</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 1, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
christianus: <entryFree id="n7891" type="main" key="Christi^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Christus</etym>, <sense id="n7891.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Christian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fides,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 16, 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 16, 8, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">religio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 9, 40, 16</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a Christian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl>; Suet. Ner. <cb n="CHRY" /> 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97</bibl>; very frequent in the Church fathers.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">a Christian clergyman</hi>, Cod. Th. 5, 5, 2; 12, 1, 50.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Christianissimus,</quote> <trans><tr>the most Christian</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 57, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 1, 1</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭānē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a Christian manner</hi> or <hi rend="ital">spirit</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">regere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 89" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 89</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
christicola: <entryFree id="n7892" type="main" key="Christi^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>Christus-colo</etym>, <sense id="n7892.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a worshipper of Christ</hi>, a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> designation for <hi rend="ital">Christian</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 3, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 80</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> Christicolūm, id. contr. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1002" default="NO"><author>Symm.</author> 2, 1002</bibl>; id. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 3, 72.</sense></entryFree>
christigena: <entryFree id="n7893" type="main" key="Christi^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Christus-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n7893.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the lineage of Christ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the posterity of Ruth</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 789</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
christipotens: <entryFree id="n7894" type="hapax" key="Christi^po^tens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christĭ-pŏtens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Christus</etym>, <sense id="n7894.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strong in Christ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> adv. Symm. 2, 709</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
christus: <entryFree id="n7895" type="main" key="Christus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Christus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xristo/s</foreign> (the Anointed, Heb. <foreign />; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 7, 7</bibl>), <sense id="n7895.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Christ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 44</bibl> Rupert. ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 97</bibl>; and in the Church fathers very freq.</sense></entryFree>
chroma: <entryFree id="n7896" type="greek" key="chro_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype> (ătŏs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 5</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrw=ma</foreign> (a color), in music, <sense id="n7896.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chromatic scale</hi> (a species of harmony in which the tones of the tetrachord measure two and a half tones, as a half, again a semitone, and then a tone and a half follow each other), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 4, 3</bibl>; cf. Dict. of Antiq. p. 645.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrōmătĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the science of this species of harmony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 5</bibl>; and: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrō-mătĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">chromatic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus, the same,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 4 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
chromis: <entryFree id="n7897" type="greek" key="chro^mis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrŏmis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> or <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xro/mis</foreign>, <sense id="n7897.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a seafish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immunda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:121" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 70, 89, § 193</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">chromin, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 153</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 16, 24, § 57</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7897.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrŏmis</orth>, <hi rend="ital">nom. propr. m.</hi>, of a satyr, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 13</bibl>; of a Trojan, <case>acc.</case> Chromim, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 675</bibl>; of a Centaur, <case>acc.</case> Chromin, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:333 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 333 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
chronicus: <entryFree id="n7898" type="greek" key="chro^ni^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrŏnĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xroniko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7898.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libri,</quote> <trans><tr>chronicles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 21, 1</bibl></cit>; so also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrŏnĭca</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ta\ xronika/</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:4:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:15:1" default="NO">17, 15, 1</bibl>; and in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">in primo chronico,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:21:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 17, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbi,</quote> <trans><tr>chronic</tr>, <tr>lingering</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 4, 7</bibl></cit>; opp. acuti morbi.— Hence the work of Caelius Aurelianus is entitled De morbis acutis et chronicis.</sense></entryFree>
chronius: <entryFree id="n7899" type="main" key="chro^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xro/nios</foreign>, <sense id="n7899.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chronic</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:28:148" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 2, 28, 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:16:135" default="NO">3, 16, 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chronographus: <entryFree id="n7900" type="greek" key="chro^no^gra^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrŏnŏgrăphus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xronogra/fos</foreign>, <sense id="n7900.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chronographer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annalist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
chrysa: <entryFree id="n7901" type="main" key="Chry_sa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xru/sh</foreign>. <sense id="n7901.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town on the coast of Troas sacred to Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 174</bibl> (cf. Hom. Il. 1, 390; 1, 452).— </sense><sense id="n7901.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">An island near Crete</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 20, § 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7901.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island of India</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:7:7" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 7, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysallis: <entryFree id="n7902" type="greek" key="chry_sallis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsallis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusalli/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7902.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gold-colored chrysalis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">aurelia</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">pupa of the butterfly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 32, 37, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:117" default="NO" valid="yes">11, 35, 41, § 117</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysanthemum: <entryFree id="n7903" type="greek" key="chry_santhe^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsanthĕmum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-mon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusa/nqemon</foreign>, <sense id="n7903.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the gold-flower</hi>, <hi rend="ital">marigold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> heliochryson, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 25, 96, § 168</bibl>.—Access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsanthes</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 403</bibl> Sillig.</sense></entryFree>
chrysas: <entryFree id="n7904" type="main" key="Chry_sas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xru/sas</foreign>, <sense id="n7904.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Sicily</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Dittaino</hi>, near which is <hi rend="ital">St. Asaro</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:44:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 44, § 96</bibl> Zumpt; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:229" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 229</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chryse: <entryFree id="n7905" type="main" key="Chry_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsē</orth>, v. Chrysa.</entryFree>
chryseis: <entryFree id="n7906" type="main" key="Chry_se_is"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, v. Chryses.</entryFree>
chryselectrum: <entryFree id="n7907" type="greek" key="chry_se_lectrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsēlectrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrush/lektron</foreign>. <sense id="n7907.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Gold-colored amber</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 12, § 51</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7907.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsē-lectrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a dark-yellow precious stone</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">amber-colored hyacinth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 43, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysendetus: <entryFree id="n7908" type="greek" key="chry_sende^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsendĕtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruse/ndetos</foreign>, <sense id="n7908.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">set in gold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inlaid with gold</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lances,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:97" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 97</bibl></cit> inscr.—Also <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳs-endĕta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. vasa), <hi rend="ital">vessels inlaid with gold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:43:11" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 43, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:94:2" default="NO">6, 94, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:97:1" default="NO">14, 97, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chryses: <entryFree id="n7909" type="main" key="Chry_ses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳses</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xru/shs</foreign>, <sense id="n7909.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a priest of Apollo</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from Chryse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the father of Astynome</hi>, on account of whose close captivity by Agamemnon, Apollo sent a pestilence upon the Grecian hosts, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 121" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 121</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:402" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 402</bibl>.—As a title of a tragedy of Pacuvius, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:46:155" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 46, 155</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131 al.</bibl>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsēïs</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xrn</foreign> <pb n="329" /> <cb n="CHRY" /> <foreign lang="greek">shi/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">his daughter Astynome</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:373" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 373</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 469</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chryseus: <entryFree id="n7910" type="greek" key="chry_se^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xru/seos</foreign>, <sense id="n7910.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">golden</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">basiliscus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>gold - colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 128</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsĕa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">golden vessels</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:95:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 95, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysippus: <entryFree id="n7911" type="main" key="Chry_sippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsippus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xru/sippos</foreign>. <sense id="n7911.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the most distinguished of the Stoic philosophers</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from Soli</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a pupil of Cleanthes and Zeno</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 23, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 75</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 27, 87 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:4:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113:18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113, 18</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 18, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:80" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 80</bibl>. —Hence, </sense><sense id="n7911.1" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsippēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Chrysippus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 30, 96</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sophisma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7911.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A physician of Cnidus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the time of Alexander the Great</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 3, 8, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:111" default="NO" valid="yes">20, 10, 43, § 111</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳ-sippēa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. herba), <hi rend="ital">a plant named after him</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 9, 60, § 93</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7911.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A freedman of Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2:8 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2, 8 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7911.4" n="IV" level="1"> Chrysippus Vettius, <hi rend="ital">an architect</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 14, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 29, 2 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
chrysis: <entryFree id="n7912" type="main" key="Chry_sis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7912.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a comic person</hi> in Terence and Trabea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:80:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 80, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:31:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 31, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:58 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 58 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
chrysites: <entryFree id="n7913" type="greek" key="chry_si_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusi/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n7913.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> phloginos, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 66, § 179</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7913.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another gold-colored precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 43, § 157</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysitis: <entryFree id="n7914" type="greek" key="chry_si_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusi=tis</foreign>. <sense id="n7914.0" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">gold-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chrysitis spuma. found in silver mines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7914.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> chrysocome, q. v., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 8, 26, § 50</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:148" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 20, 85, § 148</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysoaspides: <entryFree id="n7915" type="greek" key="chry_so^aspi^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏaspĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusoa/spides</foreign> (bearing golden shields), <sense id="n7915.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soldiers under Alexander Severus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysoberyllus: <entryFree id="n7916" type="greek" key="chry_so^be_ryllus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏbēryllus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusobh/rullos</foreign>, <sense id="n7916.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chrysoberyl</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 5, 20, § 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysocalis: <entryFree id="n7917" type="greek" key="chry_so^ca^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏcălis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7917.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> parthenium, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysocanthos: <entryFree id="n7918" type="greek" key="chry_so^canthos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏcanthos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7918.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of ivy which bears gold-colored berries</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 119</bibl>; called in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 34, 62, § 147</bibl>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳ-sŏcarpus</orth>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/karpos</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysocephalos: <entryFree id="n7919" type="greek" key="chry_so^ce^pha^lo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏcĕphălŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusoke/falos</foreign>, <sense id="n7919.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a golden basilisk</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 128</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysococcus: <entryFree id="n7920" type="main" key="chry_so^coccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏcoccus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n7920.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having golden grains</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">flos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 28</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysocolla: <entryFree id="n7921" type="greek" key="chry_so^colla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏcolla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/kolla</foreign>. <sense id="n7921.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mountain - green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">copper - green</hi>, <hi rend="ital">borax.</hi> </sense><sense id="n7921.1" n="A" level="2"> Natural, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:86 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 26, § 86 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7921.2" n="B" level="2"> Made by art, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:89 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 89 sq.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7921.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A precious stone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> amphitane, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 54, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysocome: <entryFree id="n7922" type="main" key="chry_so^co^me_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏcŏmē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, v. chrysitis.</entryFree>
chrysogonus: <entryFree id="n7923" type="main" key="Chry_so^go^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsŏgŏnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n7923.0" n="I" level="1"> L. Cornelius, <hi rend="ital">a freedman of Sylla.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n7923.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A slave of Verres</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:36:section=92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 36, § 92</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7923.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A player on the cithara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:74" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 43, 124</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysographatus: <entryFree id="n7924" type="greek" key="chry_so^gra^pha_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏgrăphātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">xrusografhs</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7924.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inlaid with gold</hi>: scuta, Val. Imp. ap. Treb. <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysolachanum: <entryFree id="n7925" type="greek" key="chry_so^la^cha^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏlăchănum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusola/xanon</foreign>, <sense id="n7925.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">garden orach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> atriplex: Atriplex hortensis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:66 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 43, § 66 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
chrysolampis: <entryFree id="n7926" type="greek" key="chry_so^lampis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏlampis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/lampis</foreign> (gold-gleaming), <sense id="n7926.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysolithos: <entryFree id="n7927" type="greek" key="chry_so^li^tho^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏlĭthŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> and <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/liqos</foreign>, <sense id="n7927.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chrysolite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the topaz of the Greeks and of modern mineralogists</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 42, § 126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl> (3), 16, 44; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 854</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 15, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysomelum: <entryFree id="n7928" type="greek" key="chry_so^me_lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏmēlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/mhlon</foreign> (golden apple), <sense id="n7928.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of quince</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 11, 10, § 37</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏmēlĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala, the same,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 10, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysopastus: <entryFree id="n7929" type="greek" key="chry_so^pastus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏpastus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/pastos</foreign>, <sense id="n7929.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a species of our topaz</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
chrysophrys: <entryFree id="n7930" type="greek" key="chry_sophrys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsophrys</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xru/sofrus</foreign>, <sense id="n7930.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sea-fish with a golden spot over each eye</hi>: Sparus aurata, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,014:111" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Hal. 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 11, 54, § 152</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysopis: <entryFree id="n7931" type="greek" key="chry_so_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsōpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusw=pis</foreign>, <sense id="n7931.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious variety of our topaz</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 156</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysoprasus: <entryFree id="n7932" type="greek" key="chry_so^pra^sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏprăsus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/prasos</foreign>, <sense id="n7932.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chrysoprase</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a precious stone of a golden-yellow and a leek-green color</hi>, Plin. <cb n="CIBA" /> 37, 5, 20, § 77; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 865</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 7, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 14, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 16, § 41 sq.; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏ-prăsĭus lăpis</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 34, § 113</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysopteros: <entryFree id="n7933" type="greek" key="chry_sopte^ro^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsoptĕrŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/pteros</foreign>, <sense id="n7933.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of jasper</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 32, § 109</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 118</bibl>, Serm. 16, § 41 sq.</sense></entryFree>
chrysorrhoas: <entryFree id="n7934" type="main" key="Chry_sorrho^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chrȳsorrhŏas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*xrusorro/as</foreign>, <sense id="n7934.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of several rivers in Cœlesyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Lydia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Bithynia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and in Pontus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 18, 16, § 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:148" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 32, 43, § 148</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 29, 30, § 110</bibl>; 6, 4, 4, § 14.</sense></entryFree>
chrysos: <entryFree id="n7935" type="greek" key="chry_so^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xruso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7935.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gold</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 6</bibl> (in a pun with the name Chrysalus).—</sense><sense id="n7935.1" n="II" level="1"> Chrysos melas, <hi rend="ital">black ivy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 98</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chrysothales: <entryFree id="n7936" type="greek" key="chry_so^tha^les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chrȳsŏthăles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xrusoqale/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7936.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of aizoon</hi> or <hi rend="ital">houseleek</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wall-pepper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">called also</hi> erithales, trithales, and isoetes, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chthonius: <entryFree id="n7937" type="main" key="Chtho^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chthŏnĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n7937.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Centaur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:441" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 441</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7937.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Sparti</hi> (produced from the teeth of the dragon), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 178" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 178</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:538" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 538</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chuni: <entryFree id="n7938" type="main" key="Chu_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Chūni</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Chunni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, v. Hunni.</entryFree>
chus: <entryFree id="n7939" type="greek" key="chu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chūs</orth>, <itype>ŏos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xou=s</foreign>, <sense id="n7939.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measure for liquids</hi>, = congius, Rhemn. Fann. Pond. 7, 70.</sense></entryFree>
chydaeus: <entryFree id="n7940" type="greek" key="chy^daeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chydaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">xudai=os</foreign> (abundant; hence), <sense id="n7940.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dactyli,</quote> <trans><tr>a kind of palms</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 4, 9, § 46</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:102" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 16, 19, § 102</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chylisma: <entryFree id="n7941" type="greek" key="chy_lisma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chȳlisma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xu/lisma</foreign>, <sense id="n7941.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the extracted juice of a plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 23" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chylus: <entryFree id="n7942" type="greek" key="chy_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chȳlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xulo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n7942.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the extracted juice of a plant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 37</bibl> and 65.</sense></entryFree>
chymus: <entryFree id="n7943" type="greek" key="chy_mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chȳmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xumo/s</foreign> (juice), <sense id="n7943.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the fluid of the stomach</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chyle</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 48, 900</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
chytropus: <entryFree id="n7944" type="greek" key="chytro^pu_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">chytrŏpūs</orth>, <itype>pŏdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">xutro/pous</foreign>, <sense id="n7944.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pot</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chafing-dish with feet for coals</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 11, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cia: <entryFree id="n7945" type="main" key="Cia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cia</orth>, v. Cea.</entryFree>
ciani: <entryFree id="n7946" type="main" key="Ci^a_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7946.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cios</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a town in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:31:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:21:22 al" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 21, 22 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cibalis: <entryFree id="n7947" type="hapax" key="ci^ba_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cibus</etym>, <sense id="n7947.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to food</hi>: fistula, <hi rend="ital">the œsophagus</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gullet</hi>, Lact. Opif. Dei, 11, 5.</sense></entryFree>
cibaria: <entryFree id="n7948" type="main" key="ci^ba_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. cibarius.</entryFree>
cibarius: <entryFree id="n7949" type="main" key="ci^ba_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cibus</etym>, <sense id="n7949.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to</hi> or <hi rend="ital">suitable for food</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">res,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: leges, i. e. <hi rend="ital">sumptuary laws</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laws restraining luxury</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 13</bibl>: uva, <hi rend="ital">suitable only for eating</hi>, not for wine, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 37</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">uva vilitatis cibariae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7949.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbārĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nutriment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victuals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">provisions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fodder</hi> (in the jurists a more restricted idea than alimenta, which comprises every thing necessary for sustaining life, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 1, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 34, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:15" default="NO">34, 1, 15</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in gen. the whole tit. 1: de alimentis vel cibariis legatis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R.
