R. 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:14" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">congerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Dig. l. l. al.—Of soldiers,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=90" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 90</bibl></cit> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 49, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 16, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:7 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 7 al.</bibl>—Of the provincial magistrates, <hi rend="ital">corn allowed to deputies</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibaria praefecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:30:section=72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 30, § 72</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 93</bibl>, §§ 216 and 217; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 9</bibl>.—Of cattle, Cato. R. R. 60; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:3:16:4" default="NO">3, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 20, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:8:5 al" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 8, 5 al.</bibl> —In <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:21:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 21, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7949.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (in accordance with the fare given to servants), <hi rend="ital">ordinary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">common</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">panis,</quote> <trans><tr>black bread</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:34:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 34, 97</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 2, 15</bibl>: panis cibarius est, qui ad cibum servis datur, nec delicatus); so <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbā-rĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, also called cibarium secundarium, <hi rend="ital">the coarser meal which remains after the fine wheat flour</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shorts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 87</bibl>: vinum, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 93, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12</bibl></cit>. 50, 18 sq.: <cit><quote lang="la">sapor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:11:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 11, 2</bibl></cit> Schneid.—</sense><sense id="n7949.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: cibarius Aristoxenus, i. e. <hi rend="ital">an ordinary musician</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 93, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cibatio: <entryFree id="n7950" type="main" key="ci^ba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cibo</etym>, <sense id="n7950.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a feeding;</hi> concr., <hi rend="ital">a meal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repast</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 1, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:1:4:3" default="NO">1, 4, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cibatus: <entryFree id="n7951" type="main" key="ci^ba_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, concr., <sense id="n7951.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">victuals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nutriment</hi> (except Pliny, only anteand post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 71</bibl>; Varr. <cb n="CICA" /> 1, 63, 2; 2, 4, 15; 2, 9, 8; 3, 8, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1093" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1093</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:1126" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 1126</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 10, 10, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:217" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 55, 81, § 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:168" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 61, 81, § 168</bibl>; 10, 73, 93, § 199; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 113</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cibdelus: <entryFree id="n7952" type="greek" key="cibde_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cibdēlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki/bdhlos</foreign>, <sense id="n7952.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spurious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">base</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fontes,</quote> <trans><tr>impure</tr>, <tr>unhealthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cibicida: <entryFree id="n7953" type="hapax" key="ci^bi^ci_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbĭcīda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cibus-caedo</etym>, <sense id="n7953.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">breadwaster</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bread-consumer</hi>, probably a humorous designation of a slave, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 88, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cibo: <entryFree id="n7954" type="main" key="ci^bo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbo</orth>, no <sense id="n7954.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cibus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to give food to animals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to feed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fodder</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">genera avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locustae utiles cibandis pullis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:11:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">draconem manu suă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>.—In <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibari,</quote> <trans><tr>to take food</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:Epit. 19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> Epit. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7954.1" n="II" level="1"> With men as objects (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:25:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 25, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,006:12:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rom. 12, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ciboria: <entryFree id="n7955" type="main" key="ci^bo_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbōrĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7955.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Egyptian bean</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 67</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ciborium: <entryFree id="n7956" type="greek" key="ci^bo_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbōrĭum</orth>. <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kibw/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n7956.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drinking-cup</hi> (made like the large leaves of the Egyptian bean), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 7, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cibus: <entryFree id="n7957" type="main" key="ci^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭbus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. root of capio</etym>, <sense id="n7957.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">food</hi> for man and beast, <hi rend="ital">victuals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nutriment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fodder</hi> (class. in prose and poetry, both in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>; syn.: esca, epulae; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. potio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:136" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 136</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cibus potusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus et vinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:29:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 29, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unda cibusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 262</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">cibum capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 60</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 2, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">capessere (of animals),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:47:122" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 47, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 5, 12, § 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantum cibi et potionis adhibendum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:11:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 2, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:10:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concoquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mandere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:54:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 54, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibos suppeditare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:27:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cleanthes) negat ullum esse cibum tam gravem, quin is die et nocte concoquatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 24</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suavissimus et idem facillimus ad concoquendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:20:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 20, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flentes orabant, ut se cibo juvarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 78 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus animalis,</quote> <trans><tr>the means of nourishment in the air</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibi bubuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:23:2" default="NO">1, 23, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus erat caro ferina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 18, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tenues hamos abdidit ante cibus,</quote> <trans><tr>the bait</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:856" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 856</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">15, 476</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7957.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to the nourishment of plants, <hi rend="ital">the nutritive juice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:353" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 353</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 2, 2, § 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7957.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">food</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sustenance</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quasi quidam humanitatis cibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 19, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus furoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa cibusque mali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cibyra: <entryFree id="n7958" type="main" key="Ci^by^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭbyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kibura</foreign>. <sense id="n7958.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in</hi> Magna Phrygia, <hi rend="ital">on the borders of Caria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abounding in manufactures</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and the seat of a Roman tribunal</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Buruz</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 14</bibl> <hi rend="ital">bis;</hi> and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 15, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7958.1" n="B" level="2"> Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭbyrāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kibura/ths</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">of Cibyra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratres quidam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:13:section=30 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 13, § 30 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pantherae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 21, 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭbyrātae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cibyra</hi>, Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 4, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">8, 9, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:25:13 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 25, 13 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n7958.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭbyrātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Cibyra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:21:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 21, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">negotia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jurisdictio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 28, 29, § 105</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7958.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town in Pamphylia</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ibura</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 92</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicada: <entryFree id="n7959" type="main" key="ci^ca_da"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcāda</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7959.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the cicada</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tree-cricket</hi>: Cicada orni, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:92 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 26, 32, § 92 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:801" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 801</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 77</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 328</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cul. 151 al.</bibl>—Worn as an ornament in the hair of the Athenians, <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cir. 128</bibl> Sillig; cf. Lidd. and Scott, under <foreign lang="greek">te/ttic</foreign>.—As <hi rend="ital">a symbol of summer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 271</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicatricor: <entryFree id="n7960" type="main" key="ci^ca_tri_cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcātrīcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>cicatrix</etym>, <sense id="n7960.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be scarred over</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cicatrized</hi> (late Lat.), Fest p. 65, 14 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:8:118" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 8, 118</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n7960.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 6, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cicatricosus: <entryFree id="n7961" type="main" key="ci^ca_tri_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcātrīcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7961.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of scars</hi>, <hi rend="ital">covered with scars</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tergum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ira (personified),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:35:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arb. 11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arb. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:ib. 4:27:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 27, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7961.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of a writing, <hi rend="ital">amended</hi> or <hi rend="ital">polished</hi> here and there, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 3</bibl>; v. the context.</sense></entryFree>
cicatricula: <entryFree id="n7962" type="main" key="ci^ca_tri_cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcātrīcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7962.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small scar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicatrix: <entryFree id="n7963" type="main" key="ci^ca_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7963.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cicatrice</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n7963.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 2, 29</bibl>; <pb n="330" /> <cb n="CICO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 6, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:9:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:21" default="NO">6, 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:100" default="NO">6, 3, 100</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:65 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 65 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:35:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 35, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 444</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 623 al.</bibl>: cicatrices adversae, <hi rend="ital">wounds in front</hi> (therefore honorable), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:28:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 28, 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 55</bibl> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">aversa,</quote> <trans><tr>on the back</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:11:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 11, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatrices adverso corpore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:1:section=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cicatricem inducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 7, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 38, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reducere ad colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 18, 76, § 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducere,</quote> <trans><tr>to cicatrize</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:32:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 32, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emendare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 13, 51, § 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tollere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 6, 14, § 23</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. also II.—</sense><sense id="n7963.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> to plants, <hi rend="ital">a mark of incision</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 379</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 12, 23, § 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:235" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 24, 37, § 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 11</bibl>. —Of the marks of tools on a statue, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 63</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n7963.3" n="2" level="3"> Humorously, of <hi rend="ital">the seam of a patched shoe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:151" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 151</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7963.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">refricare obductam jam rei publicae cicatricem,</quote> <trans><tr>to open a wound afresh</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 3, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:66" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 1:16:7 al" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 1, 16, 7 al.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ciccus: <entryFree id="n7964" type="greek" key="ciccus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">ciccus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki/kkos</foreign>, <sense id="n7964.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the thin membrane surrounding the grains of a pomegranate;</hi> hence for <hi rend="ital">something unimportant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">worthless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bagatelle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 91</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 10</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ciccum non interduim,</quote> <trans><tr>I would not give a straw</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>; id. ap. Varr. l. l.; cf. Aus. Idyll. praef. 13.</sense></entryFree>
cicer: <entryFree id="n7965" type="main" key="ci^cer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcer</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7965.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the chickpea</hi>: Cicer Arietinum, Linn. (used only in <number>sing.</number> acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 8:25:115" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 8, 25, 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:9:39:142" default="NO">9, 39, 142</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:10:3:174" default="NO">10, 3, 174</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:124 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 32, § 124 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 115</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 182</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 249</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:104" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:177" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 177</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 14, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicera: <entryFree id="n7966" type="main" key="ci^ce^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcĕra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7966.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pulse similar to the chickpea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">chickling-vetch</hi>: Lathyrus cicera, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 11, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:11:12" default="NO">2, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicercula: <entryFree id="n7967" type="main" key="ci^cercu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcercŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cicera; al. cicer; v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 32, § 124</bibl></etym>, <sense id="n7967.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of small chickpea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 12, 32, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:304" default="NO" valid="yes">18, 18, 73, § 304</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:148" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 25, 72, § 148</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Jan. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Febr. 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicerculum: <entryFree id="n7968" type="main" key="ci^cercu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcercŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7968.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an African species of the pigment</hi> sinopis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 6, 13, § 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicero: <entryFree id="n7969" type="main" key="Ci^ce^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭcĕro</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kike/rwn</foreign>, <sense id="n7969.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen in the</hi> gens Tullia. </sense><sense id="n7969.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Tullius Cicero, <hi rend="ital">the greatest of the Roman orators and writers;</hi> born on the 3d of January, 106 B.C. (648 A.U.C.), at Arpinum (hence Arpinae chartae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:19:17" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 19, 17</bibl>); <cit><quote lang="la">assassinated, at the age of sixty-three years, by the soldiers of Antonius, 43 B.C. (711 A.U.C.): ille se profecisse sciat, cui Cicero valde placebit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:112" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 112</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:114 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 114 al.</bibl>— Hence, </sense><sense id="n7969.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭcĕrōnĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ciceronian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplicitas, Plin. praef. § 22: mensa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:16:30:section=102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 16, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <trans><tr>in the villa of Cicero</tr>, <tr>at Puteoli</tr>, <tr>medicinal to the eyes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:31:2:3:section=6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 31, 2, 3, § 6</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronianus es, non Christianus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a follower of Cicero</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl></cit>, n. 30.—</sense><sense id="n7969.3" n="II" level="1"> Q. Tullius Cicero, <hi rend="ital">the brother of I.</hi>, whose work, De petitione consulatūs, is yet extant.</sense></entryFree>
ciceromastix: <entryFree id="n7970" type="main" key="Ci^ce^ro^mastix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭcĕrŏmastix</orth>, <itype>īgis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<sense id="n7970.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the scourge of Cicero</hi>, a word formed after the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*)omhroma/stic</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">a lampoon of Largius Licinius against Cicero</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 1, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cichorium: <entryFree id="n7971" type="greek" key="ci^cho^ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭchŏrĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭchŏrēum</orth>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:31:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 31, 16</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kixo/ria</foreign> (usu. <foreign lang="greek">kixw/rion</foreign>), <sense id="n7971.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">chiccory</hi>, <hi rend="ital">succory</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">endive</hi>: Cichorium intybus, etc., Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:74 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 8, 30, § 74 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:129" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 8, 39, § 129</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cici: <entryFree id="n7972" type="foreign" key="ci_ci"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīci</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki=ki</foreign>, <sense id="n7972.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Egyptian tree</hi>, palma Christi or <hi rend="ital">castor-oil tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> croton: Ricinus communis, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 7, 7, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:85" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 22, 35, § 85</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicilendrum: <entryFree id="n7973" type="main" key="cicilendrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cicilendrum</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cicimandrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7973.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">feigned names for spice</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:3:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 3, 2, 42</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 2, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicindela: <entryFree id="n7974" type="main" key="cicinde_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cicindēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>candela</etym>, <sense id="n7974.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a glowworm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 66, § 250</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=42:13" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 42, 13</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cicinnia: <entryFree id="n7975" type="gloss" key="Cicinnia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cicinnia</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">qea\ kinai/dwn</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</entryFree>
cicinus: <entryFree id="n7976" type="main" key="ci_ci^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīcĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cici</etym>: <sense id="n7976.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">oleum,</quote> <trans><tr>an aperient oil expressed from the fruit of the cici</tr>, <tr>castor-oil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 24, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:83 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 4, 41, § 83 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cicirrus: <entryFree id="n7977" type="main" key="Ci^cirrus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭcirrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*ki/kirros</foreign> = <foreign lang="greek">a)lektruw/n</foreign>), <sense id="n7977.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nickname</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 5, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cicones: <entryFree id="n7978" type="main" key="Ci^co^nes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭcŏnes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/kones</foreign>, <sense id="n7978.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thracian people near the Hebrus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 11, 18, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:520" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 520</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 12, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 2 al.</bibl> <cb n="CIEO" /></sense></entryFree>
ciconia: <entryFree id="n7979" type="main" key="ci^co_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcōnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7979.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stork</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 23, 32, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 97</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:74 al" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 74 al.</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">at Praeneste called</hi> conia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 3, 2, 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7979.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n7979.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A derisory bending of the fingers in the form of a stork</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s bill</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:58" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 58</bibl>; Hier. prol. in Sophon. Ep. 125, n. 18.—</sense><sense id="n7979.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An implement in the form of a</hi> T, <hi rend="ital">used by rustics to measure the depth of furrows</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:13:11" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 13, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7979.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A transverse pole</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moving upon a perpendicular post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">for drawing water</hi>, etc. (syn. tolleno), <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 15, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ciconinus:
<entryFree id="n7980" type="main" key="ci^co_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcōnīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>ciconia</etym>, <sense id="n7980.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of the stork</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">adventus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">cicuma</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kikumi/s</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">an owl</hi>, Gloss. post <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=381:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 381, 1</bibl> Müll. (for which cecuma, in Gloss. Isid.).</sense></entryFree>
cicur: <entryFree id="n7981" type="main" key="ci^cur"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcur</orth>, <itype>ŭris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cf. cacula</etym>, <sense id="n7981.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tame</hi> (cf. mansuetus): <cit><quote lang="la">quod a fero discretum id dicitur cicur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 91</bibl></cit> Müll. (syn. mansuetus; opp. ferus, immanis; <cit><quote lang="la">apparently not used after Cic.): cicurum vel ferarum bestiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 99</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bestiae immanes, cicures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes (opp. ferae),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:19" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7981.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mild</hi>: ingenium, Auct. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 91</bibl> Müll.: concilium, i. e. sapiens, Pac. ap. Fest. s. v. incicorem, p. 108, 3 ib.</sense></entryFree>
cicurius: <entryFree id="n7982" type="gloss" key="Ci^cu^ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭcŭrĭus</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭcŭrīnus</orth>, Bip.), <sense id="n7982.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen in the Veturian</hi> gens [sc. a cicure], <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 91</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cicuro: <entryFree id="n7983" type="hapax" key="ci^cu^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcŭro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cicur</etym>, <sense id="n7983.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to tame</hi> ( = mansuefacio), Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=91" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 91</bibl> Müll., p. 98 Bip.</sense></entryFree>
cicuta: <entryFree id="n7984" type="main" key="ci^cu_ta1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n7984.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the hemlock given to criminals as poison;</hi> prob. either Cicuta virosa or Conium maculatum, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 95, § 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 27, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:897" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 897</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 56 al.</bibl>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 53</bibl>; drunk by Socrates; <cit><quote lang="la">hence: magister sorbitio tollit quem dira cicutae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Socrates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:4:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 4, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>—To the extraordinary coldness produced by it, reference is made in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:145" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 145</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7984.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a pipe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">flute made from the stalks of the hemlock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a shepherd</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s pipe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1382" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1382</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:7:12" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 7, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n7985" type="main" key="Ci^cu_ta2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭcūta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7985.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a usurer</hi> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 69</bibl> and 175.</sense></entryFree>
cicuticen: <entryFree id="n7986" type="hapax" key="ci^cu_ti^cen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭcūtĭcen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. cicuta, II. and cano</etym>, <sense id="n7986.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a player upon a reed-pipe</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 1, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cidaris: <entryFree id="n7987" type="greek" key="ci^da^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭdăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭdar</orth>, <itype>aris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Auct. Itin. Alex. M. p. 64 Mai) [Persian; Heb. <foreign />; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ki/daris</foreign>], = <foreign lang="greek">tia/ra o)rqh/</foreign>, <sense id="n7987.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an ornament for the head of Persian kings</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a diadem</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tiara</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cidarim Persae vocabant regium capitis insigne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7987.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The crown of the Prince of Israel</hi> (in prophetic vision), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 21, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7987.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A head-dress of the high-priest of the Jews</hi> (cf. the Talmud, <foreign /> <foreign />), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 64</bibl>, n. 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> in Ezech. 7, 21, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 14, 8</bibl> (as transl. of the Heb. <foreign />, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,046:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Zach. 3, 5</bibl>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,003:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev. 8, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">16, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cieo: <entryFree id="n7988" type="main" key="ci^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭĕo</orth>, <itype>cīvi, cĭtum, 2</itype> (from the primitive form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭo</orth>, <itype>cīre, prevailing in the compounds accio, excio</itype>, etc. (cf. Prisc. pp. 865, 905, and 908 P.), are also found: <sense id="n7988.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pres.</hi> cio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:90:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 90, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 201</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 5, 1</bibl> Schneid.: <cit><quote lang="la">cimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 213</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:211" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 211</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ep. 4</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">ciant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2</bibl></cit>, n. 17, p. 358; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 91</bibl>: ciuntur, id. de Mundo, 22, p. 67), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">ki/w</foreign>, to go; and by the addition of the causative signif. like <foreign lang="greek">kine/w</foreign>, causative from <foreign lang="greek">ki/w</foreign>; v. 1. ci.</etym>. </sense><sense id="n7988.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put in motion;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stir</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shake</hi> (syn.: moveo, commoveo, concito, excito al.; <cit><quote lang="la">class. in prose and poetry): calcem,</quote> <trans><tr>to make a move in the game of chess</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:4:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 4, 2, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura omnia ciens et agitans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: inanimum est omne, quod pulsu agitatur externo; <cit><quote lang="la">quod autem est animal, id motu cietur interiore et suo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:23:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 23, 54</bibl></cit> (for which, in the same chapter, several times movere; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 23</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">remos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:801" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 801</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imo Nereus ciet aequora fundo,</quote> <trans><tr>stirs up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:419" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 419</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppes sinistrorsum citae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:9:20" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 9, 20</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7988.2" n="B" level="2"> In judic. lang. t. t.: <cit><quote lang="la">ciere erctum (lit. to put in motion, i. e.),</quote> <trans><tr>to divide the inheritance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 237</bibl></cit>; cf. erctum.—</sense><sense id="n7988.3" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to put in motion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi>: natura maris per se immobilis est, <cb n="CIEO" /> et venti et aurae cient, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:27:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 27, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltum canibus ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1250</bibl></cit>: fontes et stagna, Cic. poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:9:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 9, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonitru caelum omne ciebo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca sonitu cientur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:608" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 608</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">reboat raucum regio cita barbara bombum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:544" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 544</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n7988.4" n="II" level="1"> With reference to the terminus ad quem, <hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excite</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">call to</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> or in Aug. and post-Aug. prose for the common accire): <cit><quote lang="la">ad sese aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:43" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:272" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armatos ad pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:6:6" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aere ciere viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quos e proximis coloniis ejus rei fama civerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:84:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 84, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ultimis subsidiis cietur miles (sc. in primam aciem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 39, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille cieri Narcissum postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 30</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7988.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To call upon for help</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invoke;</hi> of invoking superior beings: <cit><quote lang="la">nocturnos manes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:490" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 490</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">luctificam Alecto dirarum ab sede sororum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 325</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vipereasque ciet Stygiā de valle sorores (i. e. Furias),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:662" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 662</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numina nota ciens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:4:549" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 4, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foedera et deos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 14, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7988.6" n="C" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to call upon any one by name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to mention by name</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">erum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comites magnā voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:578" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 578</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animamque sepulcro Condimus et magnā supremum voce ciemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 68</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamentatione flebili majores suos ciens ipsumque Pompeium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulos nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 81</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 46</bibl>: triumphum nomine ciere, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to call</hi> Io triumphe! <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:38:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 38, 12</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7988.7" n="2" level="3"> In a civil sense: patrem, <hi rend="ital">to name one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s father</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">show one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s free birth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 8, 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7988.8" n="III" level="1"> To put any course of action in progress or any passion in motion, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to excite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rouse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to produce</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cause</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occasion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">begin</hi> (very freq., esp. in poetry): <cit><quote lang="la">solis uti varios cursus lunaeque meatus Noscere possemus quae vis et causa cierent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:773" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 773</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:379" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 379</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:10:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 10, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">varias voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1059" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1059</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamenta virum commoliri atque ciere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:242" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 242</bibl></cit> Lachm. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tinnitus aere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 262</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 64</bibl> (cie tinnitus): <cit><quote lang="la">singultus ore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gemitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:517" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 517</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fletus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:344" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 468</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mugitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">murmur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 110</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 7, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 37, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:54" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 541</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli simulacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 674</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:52:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 52, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:18" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 24, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vires intimas molemque belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:47:1" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 47, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:22:7" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 22, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:19:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 19, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 33, 12</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 28, 8: Martem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 766</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies, stragem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 829</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 39, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rixam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2 al" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n7988.9" n="B" level="2"> In medic.: <cit><quote lang="la">alvum,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause evacuation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 9, 38, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 7, 28, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">menses,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause menstruation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:151 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 15, 90, § 151 sq.</bibl></cit> al.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, lit. <hi rend="ital">put in motion;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">quick</hi>, <hi rend="ital">swift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rapid</hi> (opp. tardus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:57:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 57, 216</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 5</bibl>; class.; esp. freq. in poetry; <cit><quote lang="la">rare in Cic.): ad scribendum citus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod jubeat citis quadrigis citius properet persequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:642" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 642</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bigae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:55:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 55, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puppis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 64, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:69" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">classis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:732" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 732</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">axis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:543" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 543</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plantae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:591" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:48:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 48, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agmine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 63</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">4, 25: cohortes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:16:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 16, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 1, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pes, i. e. iambus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 252</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: nullam ego rem citiorem apud homines esse quam famam reor, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=61" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 61</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 8</bibl>, ext. 1.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 14</bibl> dub.; v. Spald. and Zumpt in h. l.—</sense><sense id="n7988.10" n="B" level="2"> In the poets very freq. (also a few times in Tac.) instead of the <pos>adv.</pos> cito: <cit><quote lang="la">citi ad aedis venimus Circae, Liv. And. ap. Fest. s. v. topper, p. 352, 6 Müll.: equites parent citi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 386</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnus fugiens citus abiit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 42</bibl></cit>: solvite vela citi, Verg, A. 4, 574; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:ib. 9:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 37</bibl>; 12, 425; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 92</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:7:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 3, 7, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ite citi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:562" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 562</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si citi advenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7988.11" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭto</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> </sense><sense id="n7988.12" n="a" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Quickly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">speedily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">soon</hi> (freq. in prose and poetry of all periods): <cit><quote lang="la">quam tarda es! non vis citius progredi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 6, 2</bibl></cit>; <pb n="331" /> <cb n="CILI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eloquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:4:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 4, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abi cito et suspende te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">labascit victus uno verbo: quam cito!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:1:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 1, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eum negasti, qui non cito quid didicisset, umquam omnino posse perdiscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:36:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 36, 146</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:335" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 335</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:8:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:2" default="NO">11, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:6:2" default="NO">10, 6, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum praestant sed cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: sat cito si sat bene, a moral saying of Cato in <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 66</bibl>, n. 9: <cit><quote lang="la">cito rumpes arcum, semper si tensum habueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:14:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 14, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad paenitendum properat cito qui judicat, Publ. Syr. Sent. 6: scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis cito diligere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:78" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cito absolvere, tarde condemnare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 1, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:3:31" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 3, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 557</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Noto citius, Verg.A.5, 242 et saep.: dicto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 80</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 142</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">supremā die, i. e. ante supremam diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serius aut citius sedem properamus ad unam (for which serius ocius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 26</bibl></cit>), <hi rend="ital">sooner or later</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 33</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">citissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> al.—</sense><sense id="n7988.13" n="b" level="4"> With the negative, sometimes equivalent to non facile, <hi rend="ital">not easily</hi> (cf. the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ta/xa</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">haud cito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque verbis aptiorem cito alium dixerim, neque sententiis crebriorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:76:264" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 76, 264</bibl></cit>: quem tu non tam cito rhetorem dixisses quam <foreign lang="greek">politiko/n</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> § 265.—</sense><sense id="n7988.14" n="c" level="4"> Sometimes in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi> without the negative, = potius, <hi rend="ital">sooner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rather</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut citius diceres, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:67:238" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 67, 238 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citius dixerim, jactasse se aliquos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:18:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 18, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 35</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n7988.15" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭtē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">quickly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 198" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 198</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cignus: <entryFree id="n7989" type="main" key="cignus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cignus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n7989.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measure</hi>, = 8 scrupuli, <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 2, 30</bibl> and 31.</sense></entryFree>
cilibantum: <entryFree id="n7990" type="main" key="cilibantum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cilibantum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n7990.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a round cupboard</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=121" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 121</bibl> Müll.; cf. cilliba.</sense></entryFree>
cilices: <entryFree id="n7991" type="main" key="Ci^li^ces"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlĭces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, v. Cilicia.</entryFree>
cilicia: <entryFree id="n7992" type="main" key="Ci^li^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlĭcĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kiliki/a</foreign>, <sense id="n7992.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a province in the southern part of Asia Minor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Pamphylia and Syria</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ejalet Itschil</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:11:2" default="NO">1, 11, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:13:1" default="NO">1, 13, 1</bibl> sq.; 2, 7, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 22, § 91</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:1:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 1, 1, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:22:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 22, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:2 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 2 sq.</bibl> al.— </sense><sense id="n7992.1" n="II" level="1"> Hence, </sense><sense id="n7992.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype> (<case>abl.</case> Cilici, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl> Lachm.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 399 al.</bibl>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>), <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/lic</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Cilician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cilici croco (of special excellence),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 416</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 399</bibl> Sillig; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:1:160" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 1, 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 217</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:95" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tamira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos> in <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlĭ-ces</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/likes</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the Cilicians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Cilicia</hi>, <hi rend="ital">notorious for the practice of piracy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 15, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 101</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:2:67" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:78 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 78 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrestium Cilicum nationes quibus Clitarum cognomentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 55</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Acc.</hi> Gr. Cilicas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:16:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 16, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cilices Clitae,</quote> <trans><tr>a barbarous tribe in the mountains of Cilicia</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 55</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 41</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n7992.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Fem.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlissa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/lissa</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">Cilician</hi> (cf. Phoenissa, from Phoenix), <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra Cilissa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:198" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spica,</quote> <trans><tr>of crocus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 74; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 76</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n7992.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlĭcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cilician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 26, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cotes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:22:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 22, 47</bibl></cit>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">164 and 165: crocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 6, 17, § 31</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n7992.5" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭ-lĭcĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kili/kion</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">originally made of Cilician goats</hi>' <hi rend="ital">hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">used by soldiers and seamen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:11:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 11, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:38:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 38, § 95</bibl> Ascon.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 7, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 14, 3</bibl>; also <pos>adj.</pos>: <cit><quote lang="la">vela,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:17" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12" default="NO">33, 7, 12</bibl>; cf. also udones, <hi rend="ital">made of Cilician goats</hi>' <hi rend="ital">hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:148" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 148</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n7992.6" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlĭcĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cilician</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B.
