C. 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:67:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 67, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicinus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:2:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ciliciarius: <entryFree id="n7993" type="gloss" key="ci^li^ci^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭlĭcĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cilicium; v. Cilicia, II. B. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n7993.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a maker of hair coverings</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4162</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cilicinus: <entryFree id="n7994" type="main" key="ci^li^ci_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭlĭcīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n7994.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of hair-cloth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tentoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33</bibl></cit>: tunica, Hier. Vit. Hil. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:26:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 26, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ciliciolum: <entryFree id="n7995" type="main" key="ci^li^ci^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭlĭcĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cilicium</etym>, <sense id="n7995.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small garment</hi> or <hi rend="ital">coverlet of goats</hi>' <hi rend="ital">hair</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 71, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">108, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cilicium: <entryFree id="n7996" type="main" key="Ci^li^ci^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlĭcĭum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlĭcĭus</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlissa</orth>, v. Cilicia.</entryFree>
cilio: <entryFree id="n7997" type="main" key="ci_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīlĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (a vulgar collat. form of caelum), <sense id="n7997.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a chisel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">graver</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 4, 7</bibl>. <cb n="CIMM" /></sense></entryFree>
cilium: <entryFree id="n7998" type="main" key="ci^li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kuli/s, ku/la</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n7998.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An eyelid</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43:3" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43, 3</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 39, 93, § 227</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 247, 10</bibl>; Lact. Opif. Dei, 10 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n7998.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the lower eyelid</hi> (opp. supercilium): <cit><quote lang="la">extremum ambitum genae superioris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 57, § 157</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cilix: <entryFree id="n7999" type="main" key="Ci^lix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭlix</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, v. Cilicia, II. A.</entryFree>
cilla: <entryFree id="n8000" type="main" key="Cilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/lla</foreign>, <sense id="n8000.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Troas</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for the worship of Apollo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 30, 32, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 227" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 227</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Cillan. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:174" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 174</bibl> (cf. Hom. Il. 1, 38).</sense></entryFree>
cilliba: <entryFree id="n8001" type="greek" key="cilli^ba"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cillĭba</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">killi/bas</foreign>, <sense id="n8001.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a round dining-table</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=118" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 118</bibl> Müll.; Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43, 9</bibl> ib.</sense></entryFree>
cillo: <entryFree id="n8002" type="gloss" key="cillo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cillo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n8002.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to move</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put in motion</hi> (only in mal. part.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg. G. 2, 389</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 20, 14, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8003" type="main" key="cillo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cillo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. cillo</etym>, = cinaedus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pseudo</author> ic. in Sall. 6, 18</bibl>.</entryFree>
cilnius: <entryFree id="n8004" type="main" key="Cilni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cilnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>pure Etrusc. Cfelne or Cfenle</etym>, <sense id="n8004.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a designation of a very distinguished Etruscan</hi> gens, <hi rend="ital">from which Mœcenas originated; Cilnian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 5, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:29" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 4, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cilo: <entryFree id="n8005" type="gloss" key="cilo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cilo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8005.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a prominent forehead pressed in upon the sides</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, p. 78</bibl> P.; <hi rend="ital">a dim.</hi> of it, cilunculus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8006" type="main" key="Ci_lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8006.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman cognomen</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cim: <entryFree id="n8007" type="main" key="Cim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cim</orth>, <itype>indecl.</itype> <sense id="n8007.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">n.</hi>: nomen vici, Cels. ap. Prisc. pp. 644 and 688 P.</sense></entryFree>
cimber: <entryFree id="n8008" type="main" key="Cimber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype>, v. Cimbri.</entryFree>
cimbri: <entryFree id="n8009" type="main" key="Cimbri"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimbri</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/mbroi</foreign> [Cimbri linguā Gallicā latrones dicuntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43:7" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43, 7</bibl>], <sense id="n8009.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Northern Germany</hi> (in Holstein, Silesia, and Jutland); <cit><quote lang="la">on their irruption into Italy conquered by Marius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 67, 67, § 167</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:94" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 27, § 94</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 4</bibl>; Liv. Epit. l<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 63</bibl>-68; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:31 sq" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 31 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:20:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 20, 60</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:65" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:12:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 12, 38</bibl>.—In <number>sing.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimber</orth>, <itype>bri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a Cimbrian</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:10:6" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 10, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:3:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 3, 29</bibl>; and <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cimbrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:3:45" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 3, 45</bibl></cit>.—Cimber, also, <hi rend="ital">a cognomen of</hi> L. Tillius, <hi rend="ital">one of the murderers of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 11, 27</bibl>; Cass. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 13, 3</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8009.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimbrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cimbrian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manubiae, Auct. Or. pro Dom. 38, 102: bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 61, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 22, 22, § 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:3:20" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 3, 20</bibl>.—* <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimbrĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the manner of the Cimbrians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cimeliarcha: <entryFree id="n8010" type="greek" key="ci_me_li^archa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīmēlĭarcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">keimhlia/rxhs</foreign>, <sense id="n8010.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a treasurer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keeper of treasure</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 72, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cimeliarchium: <entryFree id="n8011" type="greek" key="ci_me_li^archi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīmēlĭarchĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">keimhlia/rxion</foreign>, <sense id="n8011.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where jewels are deposited</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a treasury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 7, 72, 10, § 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 47, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cimetra: <entryFree id="n8012" type="main" key="Cime_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimē^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8012.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of Samnium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 15, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cimex: <entryFree id="n8013" type="main" key="ci_mex"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīmex</orth>, <itype>ĭcis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (so always acc. to Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 619 sq.; but <sense id="n8013.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:10:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 10, 47</bibl> § 136 Sillig and Jan.), <hi rend="ital">a bug</hi>, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=210:17" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 210, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:18:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 14, 45, § 131</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 17, § 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 33, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 14, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 23, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 98, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:32 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 32 al.</bibl>—As a term of reproach, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 78</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cimico: <entryFree id="n8014" type="gloss" key="ci_mi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cīmĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, = <foreign lang="greek">kori/zw</foreign>, <sense id="n8014.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to purify from bugs</hi>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</sense></entryFree>
ciminus: <entryFree id="n8015" type="main" key="Ci^mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭmĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8015.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a lake in Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near Sutrium</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Lago di Vico</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">di Ronciglione</hi>, <hi rend="ital">with a mountain forest lying near it</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:697" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 697</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭmĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Ciminian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <trans>i.e. <tr>Ciminus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:16:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 24, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 96, 98, § 211</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saltus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:17:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 17, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:36:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 36, 11</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭ-mĭnĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the region about Lake Ciminus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 7, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cimmerii: <entryFree id="n8016" type="main" key="Cimme^rii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimmĕrii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<sense id="n8016.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Cimmeriūm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:399" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 399</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Cimmeriōn,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 64</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kimme/rioi</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n8016.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Thracian people in the present Crimea</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on both sides of the Dnieper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose chief town was</hi> Cimmerium, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:15" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 6, 5, § 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:35" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 13, 14, § 35</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n8016.2" n="B" level="2"> <pos>Adj.</pos> </sense><sense id="n8016.3" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimmĕrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Cimmerian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bosporus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 24, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:10:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 10, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8016.4" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cimmĕrĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">Cimmerian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.— <cb n="CINC" /> </sense><sense id="n8016.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A fabulous people supposed to have dwelt in caves</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between Baiœ and Cumœ</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43:4 sq" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43, 4 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 61</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 19, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:132" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 132</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">perpetual darkness prevailed among them,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:64" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:398" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 398</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">here Somnus had his abode,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:592 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 592 sq.</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the Lower World</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cimmerii lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:5:24" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 5, 24</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cul. 230</bibl>; v. Lidd. and Scott, under <foreign lang="greek">*kimme/rioi</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
cimolus: <entryFree id="n8017" type="main" key="Ci^mo_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭmōlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/mwlos</foreign>, <sense id="n8017.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an island of the Cyclades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for its chalky soil</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Kimolo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Argentiera</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:463" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 463</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8017.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭmō-lĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from Cimolus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">creta (freq. used in medicine),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 245" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:195 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 17, 57, § 195 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cimon: <entryFree id="n8018" type="main" key="Ci_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīmon</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīmo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:4" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 4</bibl>, ext. 2), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/mwn</foreign>. <sense id="n8018.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Father of Miltiades</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8018.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A son of Miltiades</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a distinguished general of the Athenians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose life is written by Nepos</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 1</bibl> sqq.; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:18:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 18, 64</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:24, p. 275" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 24, p. 275</bibl> sqq. Bip.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 3</bibl>, ext. 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinaedias: <entryFree id="n8019" type="greek" key="ci^naedi^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnaedĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kinaidi/as</foreign>, <sense id="n8019.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi>, unknown to us, <hi rend="ital">said to be found in the brain of the fish</hi> cinaedus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinaedicus: <entryFree id="n8020" type="main" key="ci^naedi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnaedĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cinaedus, 1.</etym>, <sense id="n8020.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to one who is unchaste; immodest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lewd</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cantio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—<pos>Subst.</pos> = cinaedus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 7, 1</bibl> (769); Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 176, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinaedulus: <entryFree id="n8021" type="hapax" key="ci^naedu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnaedŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8021.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a male wanton</hi>, Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinaedus: <entryFree id="n8022" type="greek" key="ci^naedus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnaedus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ki/naidos</foreign>. <sense id="n8022.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who practises unnatural lust</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sodomite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">catamite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 3, 2, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 5, 40</bibl>; Scip. Afric. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:12:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 12, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:10" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:30 al" default="NO">14, 30 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8022.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnaedus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">wanton</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unchaste</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut decuit cinaediorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 24</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">impudent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">shameless</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo cinaedā fronte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:39:12" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 39, 12</bibl></cit>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n8022.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who performs a wanton dance</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 73</bibl>; Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 5, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8022.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The name of a sea-fish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 53, § 146</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n8023" type="main" key="ci^naedus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnaedus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 1. cinaedus, I. B.</entryFree>
cinara: <entryFree id="n8024" type="greek" key="ci^na^ra1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kina/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n8024.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of artichoke</hi> (Cinara scolymus, Linn.), <hi rend="ital">a native of the island of Cinara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:235" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:14" default="NO">11, 3, 14</bibl> and 28; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 206" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 206</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8025" type="main" key="Ci^na^ra2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭnăra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kina/ra</foreign>. <sense id="n8025.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Greek proper name</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 4 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8025.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An island in the Ægean Sea</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Zinara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 23, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinaris: <entryFree id="n8026" type="main" key="ci^na^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8026.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an unknown plant</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 27, 41, § 101</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 19, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cincia: <entryFree id="n8027" type="main" key="Cincia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cincia</orth>, v. Cincius, IV.</entryFree>
cincinnalis: <entryFree id="n8028" type="main" key="cincinna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cincinnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cincinnus</etym>, <sense id="n8028.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">curled</hi>: herba, <hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> polytrichon, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cincinnatulus: <entryFree id="n8029" type="hapax" key="cincinna_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cincinnātŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n8029.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [cincinnatus], <hi rend="ital">with curled hair</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 130</bibl></cit>, n. 19.</sense></entryFree>
cincinnatus: <entryFree id="n8030" type="main" key="cincinna_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cincinnātus</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cincinnus</etym>, <sense id="n8030.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with curled hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having locks</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ringlets of hair</hi> (as an indication of luxurious effeminacy), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 115</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moechus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">consul,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 11, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ganeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,019:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Red. in Sen. 5, 13</bibl></cit>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:61" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 61</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8030.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of comets: stellae, Schol. Juv 6, 207 (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 14</bibl>, better crinitas).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8031" type="main" key="Cincinna_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cincinnātus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8031.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a cognomen of the renownea</hi> L. Qumctius, <hi rend="ital">taken from the plough to the dictatorship</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 26, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:13:14" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 13, 14</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:4:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 4, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:16:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 16, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl>, praef. § 13; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 3, 4, § 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:4:4 al" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 4, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cincinnus: <entryFree id="n8032" type="greek" key="cincinnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cincinnus</orth>, i. <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ki/kinnos</foreign> and Lat. cirrus; Sanscr. cicura, crinis, Bopp, Gloss. 124 a</etym>, <sense id="n8032.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">curled hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a lock</hi> or <hi rend="ital">curl of hair</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 2, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:31:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 31, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:11:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 11, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8032.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">too artificial</hi> or <hi rend="ital">elaborate oratorical ornament</hi> (cf. calamister, II.): <cit><quote lang="la">in oratoris aut in poëtae cincinnis ac fuco offenditur, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:25:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 25, 100</bibl></cit>; Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinciolus: <entryFree id="n8033" type="main" key="Cinci^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cincĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>Cincius</etym>, <sense id="n8033.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pet name for Cincius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 286</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cincius: <entryFree id="n8034" type="main" key="Cinci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cincĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n8034.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens; hence, </sense><sense id="n8034.1" n="I" level="1"> M. Cincius Alimentus, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="332" /> <cb n="CINE" /> <hi rend="ital">tribune of the people</hi>, A.U.C. 549, <hi rend="ital">whose legal enactment was called</hi> Lex Cincia De donis et muneribus (quā cavetur antiquitus, ne quis ob causam orandam pecuniam donumve accipiat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 5</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:71:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 71, 286</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 20, 7</bibl>; also: Lex muneralis, Plaut. ap. Paul. ex Fest. s. v. muneralis, p. 143 Müll.; cf. Savigny upon the Lex Cincia, etc., in his Zeitschr. für Gesch. Rechtswissenschaft IV., I. 1, pp. 1-59; Rudorff, de L. Cincia.— </sense><sense id="n8034.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Cincius Alimentus, <hi rend="ital">a distinguished Roman historian in the time of the second Punic war</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 38, 3</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. the same with the consul L. Cincius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:28:11" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 28, 11</bibl>; cf. Bähr, <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> Gesch. p. 257; Hertz, de L. Cinciis.—</sense><sense id="n8034.3" n="III" level="1"> L. Cincius, <hi rend="ital">the business agent of Atticus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 1, 7</bibl> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi>; 1, 16, 17; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8034.4" n="IV" level="1"> Cincia, locus Romae, ubi Cinciorum monimentum fuit, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=57:5" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 57, 5</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=262:4" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 262, 4</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
cinctia: <entryFree id="n8035" type="main" key="Cinctia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cinctia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Cinxia.</entryFree>
cincticulus: <entryFree id="n8036" type="main" key="cincti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>2. cinctus</etym>, <sense id="n8036.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little girdle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinctor: <entryFree id="n8037" type="gloss" key="cinctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctor</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">zw/sths</foreign>, Gloss. Gr. Lat.</entryFree>
cinctorium: <entryFree id="n8038" type="main" key="cincto_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>2. cinctus</etym>, <sense id="n8038.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swordbelt</hi>, = balteus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:1:13" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 1, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8038.1" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi> (late Lat.); <cit><quote lang="la">trop.: et erit... fides cinctorium renum ejus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 11, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cinctum: <entryFree id="n8039" type="main" key="cinctum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. 2. cinctus.</entryFree>
cinctura: <entryFree id="n8040" type="main" key="cinctu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. cinctus, cingo</etym>, <sense id="n8040.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nncture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi> (very rare), * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl>; * Quint 11, 3, 139.</sense></entryFree>
cinctus: <entryFree id="n8041" type="main" key="cinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from cingo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8042" type="main" key="cinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (post-class. access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 163" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 163</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 33</bibl>, Pophyr. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 50</bibl>) [cingo]. <sense id="n8042.0" n="I" level="1"> Abstr., <hi rend="ital">a girding</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">cottidiani cinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 64</bibl></cit>; cinctus Gabinus, <hi rend="ital">a manner of girding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in which the toga was tucked up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">its corner being thrown over the left shoulder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was brought under the right arm round to the breast</hi> (this manner was customarily employed in religious festivals), Liv 5, 46, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">incinctus cinctu Gabino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 9, 9</bibl></cit> (for which, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 3</bibl>: incinctus Gabino cultu); <cit><quote lang="la">Quirinalt trabeā cinctuque Gabino Insignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:612" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 612</bibl></cit> Serv; Inscr Orell. 642; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 24, 7</bibl>; Dict. of Antiq.—</sense><sense id="n8042.1" n="II" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belt</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinctus et cingulum a cingendo, alterum viris, alterum mulieribus attributum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=114" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 114</bibl></cit> Müll., cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig 19, 33, 1</bibl> (in good prose, although not in Cic.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 6, 59, § 110</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:42" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 4, 9, § 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 51</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:77" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 77</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor 1, 9, p. 346</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinctutus: <entryFree id="n8043" type="main" key="cinctu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>a lengthened form from cinctus, like astutus, actutum, versutus, etc., from astus, actus, versus, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n8043.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">girded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">girt</hi> (rare; perh. only in the foll. exs.): Luperci, * Ov F 5, 101 Cethegi, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the ancients</hi> (who did not, like the more effeminate men of a later time, wear the tunic ungirded), * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> A. P 50</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cineas: <entryFree id="n8044" type="main" key="Ci_ne^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīnĕas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kine/as</foreign>, <sense id="n8044.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the friend of king Pyrrhus of Epirus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who counselled him to make peace with the Romans</hi>, he is said to have had a remarkably retentive memory, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:24:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 24, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 13, 43</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fam 9, 25, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 24, 24, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes">14, 1, 3, § 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr 1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr 1</bibl>, prooem. p. 65 Bip.</sense></entryFree>
cinefactus: <entryFree id="n8045" type="hapax" key="ci^ne^factus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕfactus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cinis-facio</etym>: <sense id="n8045.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">at nos horrifico cinefactum te prope busto ... deflevimus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turned to ashes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:906" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 906</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 93, 33</bibl> (Lachm. ad loc. makes the word = qui jam prope cineris colorem et adspectum nanctus est, but cf. Munro ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
cineraceus: <entryFree id="n8046" type="main" key="ci^ne^ra_ce^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕrācĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cinis</etym>, <sense id="n8046.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">similar to ashes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ashy</hi> terra, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 5, 4, § 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <trans><tr>ash-colored</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 7, 27, § 44</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cinerarium: <entryFree id="n8047" type="gloss" key="ci^ne^ra_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕrārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, v. cinerarius, II. B.</entryFree>
cinerarius: <entryFree id="n8048" type="main" key="ci^ne^ra_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cinis</etym>, <sense id="n8048.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to ashes.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8048.1" n="I" level="1"> As <pos>adj.</pos> very rare: fines, <hi rend="ital">boundaries of land bordering upon graves</hi>, Auct. Limit. p 296 Goes.—</sense><sense id="n8048.2" n="II" level="1"> More freq. <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8048.3" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕrārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a servant who heated in glowing ashes the iron used in curling hair</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a hair-curler</hi>, Varr. L. L, 5, § <cit><quote lang="la">129 Müll.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:61:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 61, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Const. 14:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Const. 14, 1</bibl>; Acro ad Hor S. 1, 2, 98; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Uxor. 2, 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8048.4" n="B" level="2"> <itype>CINERARIVM, ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, in tombs, <hi rend="ital">the receptacle for the ashes of the dead</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4358</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4513 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cineresco: <entryFree id="n8049" type="main" key="ci^ne^resco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕresco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n8049.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> <cb n="CING" /> <hi rend="ital">to ashes</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 40</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinereus: <entryFree id="n8050" type="main" key="ci^ne^re^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕrĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cinis</etym>, <sense id="n8050.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">similar to ashes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ash-colored</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">color,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:23" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:183 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 68, § 183 sq.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:192" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 16, 54, § 192</bibl></cit> uva, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 3, 4, § 42</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕrĕum</orth>, <itype>ĕi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of salve</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 37" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 37</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">collyrium spodiacum a quibusdam cinereum dicitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:ib. 24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cinericius: <entryFree id="n8051" type="hapax" key="cine^ri^ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinĕrĭcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8051.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">similar to ashes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">like ashes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:9:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 9, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cinerosus: <entryFree id="n8052" type="main" key="ci^ne^ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĕrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n8052.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of ashes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 4, p. 150, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canities,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7</bibl></cit>, p. 299, 41.</sense></entryFree>
cinga: <entryFree id="n8053" type="main" key="Cinga"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cinga</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8053.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small river in</hi> Hispania Tarraconensis, <hi rend="ital">in the territory of the</hi> Ilergetes, now <hi rend="ital">Cinca</hi>, Caes B C. 1, 48; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 21</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cingetorix: <entryFree id="n8054" type="main" key="Cingeto^rix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cingetŏrix</orth>, <itype>igis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n8054.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Gaul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rival of his father-in-law Indutiomarus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in respect to dominion over the</hi> Treviri, Caes B. G. 5, 3; 5, 56 al—</sense><sense id="n8054.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of the region about Cantium</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Britain</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cingilia: <entryFree id="n8055" type="main" key="Cingilia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cingilia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n8055.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the Vestini on the Adriatic Sea</hi>, Liv 8, 29, 13.</sense></entryFree>
cingillum: <entryFree id="n8056" type="main" key="cingillum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cingillum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cingulum</etym>, <sense id="n8056.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small girdle</hi>, Petr 67, 4; Not. Tir. p 158 Grut.; cf.: cingillus, <foreign lang="greek">stro/fion, zw/nion</foreign>, Gloss.</sense></entryFree>
cingo: <entryFree id="n8057" type="main" key="cingo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cingo</orth>, <itype>xi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. Gr <foreign lang="greek">kullo/s, kurto/s</foreign>; <cit><quote lang="la">Lat. curvus, and clingo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Griech. Etym. p. 545 sq" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Griech. Etym. p. 545 sq.</bibl></cit></etym>, <sense id="n8057.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to go round in a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">environ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gird</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wreathe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crown</hi>, etc. (class. in prose and poetry). </sense><sense id="n8057.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop </sense><sense id="n8057.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid autem interius mente? Cingatur igitur corpore externo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>it must be enclosed in a body</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim coronà consessus vester cinctus est, ut solebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium insolitā trepidum cinxere coronă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 321</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">tris (navīs) Eurus... Inhdit vadis atque aggere cingit harenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A 1, 112</bibl></cit>: cincta serpentibus Hydra, id. ib 7, 658: pennae ritu coepere volucrum Cingere utrumque latus, <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, Ov M. 6, 718, apio fasces et secto cingere porro, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:371" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 371</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8057.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8057.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To surround the body with a girdle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to gird on</hi> (the sword), <hi rend="ital">to gird;</hi> esp. freq in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with <case>abl.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to be girded</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircled with something</hi>. iam quasi zonā, liene cinctus ambulo, Plaut Curc. 2, 1, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:3:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 3, 19</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cui lati clavi jus erit, ita cingatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut cingeretur fluxiore cincturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispano cingitur gladio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 10, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:21:13" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 21, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig 49</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 35</bibl></cit>: ense, Ov F. 2, 13: cingor fulgentibus armis, Verg A. 2, 749; 11, 188, 11, 536; his cingi telis, id <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 2, 520</bibl>: ense latus cingit, Ov F. 2, 784; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:41" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 4, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinctas resolvite vestes, Ov M. 1, 382. filios balteis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Lev 8, 13</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in <hi rend="ital">pass</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (cf. accingor, II., and Zumpt, Gr § <cit><quote lang="la">458): inutile ferrum Cingitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:511" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 511</bibl></cit>: cinctaeque ad pectora vestes Bracchia docta movent, Ov M. 6, 59.—Without case: Syrinx, Ov M. 1, 695; <cit><quote lang="la">puer alte cinctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 10</bibl></cit>.—Hence, in late Lat. cinctus = armis instructus, armatus, <hi rend="ital">armed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">equipped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enrolled</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinctus in aliā militiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:38" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 1, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:25" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 39, 1, 25</bibl>.—As a girding up of the Roman dress was necessary in pursuits requiring physical action, hence, cingor (cf accingor), <hi rend="ital">to make one</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s self ready for any thing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prepare</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingitur, certe expedit se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 152</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">cingitur ipse furens certatim in proelia Turnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:486" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 486</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">supra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:138" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 138</bibl></cit>; Hor S. 2, 8, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 59</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8057.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To encircle with a garland</hi> or <hi rend="ital">crown</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to crown</hi> (freq., esp in the poets). </sense><sense id="n8057.6" n="a" level="4"> Of the head: <cit><quote lang="la">muralique caput summum cinxere coronā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:607" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 607</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Ov A. A. 3, 392 tempora floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:25:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 25, 20</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Verg A. 5, 71: spicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:1:4" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">comam lauro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:30:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 30, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Graias barbara vitta comas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:78" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 163</bibl>: de tenero cingite flore caput, Ov F 3, 254.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atlantis, cinctum assidue cui nubibus atris Piniferum caput et vento pulsatur et imbri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 248</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 658</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 1, 61.—</sense><sense id="n8057.7" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To encircle other parts of the body</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus lacertos anuli mei cingant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:100:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 100, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8057.8" n="3" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encircle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">invest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">enclose</hi> (the prevailing signif. in prose, esp. in the histt.; syn.: circumdo, claudo): (Tellus) oras maris undique cingens,<cb n="CINI" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:633" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 633</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:286" default="NO" valid="yes">64, 286</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Dubis paene totum oppidum cingit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl></cit> provincia mari cincta, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbe portus ipse cingitur et continetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:37:section=96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 37, § 96</bibl></cit> Zumpt: <cit><quote lang="la">quod moenibus cingebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (terra) magnā ex parte cingitur fluctibus, speciem insulae praebet, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:23" default="NO">8, 10, 23</bibl>; Ov A. A. 2, 469: cingitur insula tribus millibus passuum, i.e. <hi rend="ital">has a circuit of</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 12, 13, § 32</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinxerunt aethera nimbi,</quote> <trans><tr>covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">medium diem cinxere tenebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 939" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 939</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">diligentius urbem religione quam ipsis moenibus cingitis,</quote> <trans><tr>fortify</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 94</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8057.9" n="4" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">to surround a place</hi> or <hi rend="ital">army for defence</hi> or <hi rend="ital">in a hostile manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fortify</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to invest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">besiege</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coronā militum cincta urbs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 27, 7</bibl></cit>: castra vallo, id 7, 39, 8 equites cornua cinxere. <hi rend="ital">covered</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 29, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultimum agmen validā manu,</quote> <trans><tr>to cover</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem obsidione,</quote> <trans><tr>to besieye</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 52</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">dextera cingitur amni,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 469</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(hostem) stationibus in modum obsidii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingi ab armis hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:8:69" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 8, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:3:37" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 3, 37</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 3, 42.—Trop Sicilia multis undique cincta persons. Cio. Imp. Pomp 11, 30.—</sense><sense id="n8057.10" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To escort</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to accompany</hi> inermi item regi praetor Achaeorum et unus ex purpuratis latus cingebant, Liv 32, 39, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">dum latus sancti cingit tibi turba senatus, Ov P. 4, 9, 17: nec noscitur ulli, Agminibus comitum qui mode cinctus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Tr. 1:5:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cincta virgo matrum catervā, id M. 12, 216, Vell 2, 14, 1,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 77</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Sil 4, 448,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 322</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n8057.11" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To peel off the bark around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingere est deglabrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:7:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 7, 6</bibl></cit> Pr, cf. Plin 17, 24, 37, § 234 sqq.</sense></entryFree>
cingula: <entryFree id="n8058" type="main" key="cingu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cingŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. cingulum.</entryFree>
cingulum: <entryFree id="n8059" type="main" key="cingu^lum1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cingŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cin-gulus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n8059.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">m</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">cingŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, cf cingulum hominum generis neutri est, nam animailum feminino genere dicimus has cingulas, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig 20, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> ad Verg A. 9, 360</bibl>) [cingo, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=114" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 114</bibl> Müll.]. </sense><sense id="n8059.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The girdle encircling the hips</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a zone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belt</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>). </sense><sense id="n8059.2" n="A" level="2"> For persons; mostly for women. </sense><sense id="n8059.3" n="(a)" level="5"> Cingulum, Varr L. L. 5, § 114 Müll.; id. ap. Non. p 47, 27; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Fesc. 11, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cingulo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 21, 2</bibl></cit>.—More freq. in <number>plur.</number>, cingula, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:492" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 492</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 360</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 942</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:471" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 471</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">a money belt</hi>, Just Nov 12, 1; <hi rend="ital">a sword-belt</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:942" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 942</bibl>.—Hence, meton., <hi rend="ital">soldiership</hi>, <hi rend="ital">military service</hi>, Cod <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:38:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 38, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:17:3" default="NO">12, 17, 3</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">the bride</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s girdle</hi>: cingulo nova nupta praecingebatur, quod vir in lecto solvebat, Paul ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:P. 63" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> P. 63</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n8059.4" n="(b)" level="5"> Cingula, ae, Titin. ap. Non p 536, 19; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 444</bibl> dub. (Merk, lingula).—</sense><sense id="n8059.5" n="B" level="2"> For animals: cingula, ae, <hi rend="ital">a girth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">belt</hi>, Ov R. Am 236; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:6:41" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 6, 41</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">plur. abl.</hi> cingulis, Flor 2, 18, 14.—</sense><sense id="n8059.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a girdle of the earth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a zone</hi>: cingulus, i, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. Somn. Scip. 2, 5, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8060" type="main" key="Cingu^lum2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cingŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8060.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small town in Picenum</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cingulo</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 11, 1</bibl>; also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cingŭla saxa</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:34" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 34</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">its inhabitants</hi> were called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cin-gŭlāni</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 13, 18, § 111</bibl>.—Also <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cingūlānus</orth> <itype>ager</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Colon. p. 121" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Colon. p. 121</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
cinifes: <entryFree id="n8061" type="greek" key="cinifes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinifes</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnĭphes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cyn-</orth>), <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sknipes</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">kni/pes</foreign>, <sense id="n8061.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of stinging insect</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Aug Trin. 3, 7; Hier. in Joel, 2, 25; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ciniflo: <entryFree id="n8062" type="hapax" key="ci^ni_flo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnīflo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>cinis-flo, or instead of cinilio</etym>, = cinerarius, <sense id="n8062.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hair-curler</hi>, Hor S. 1, 2, 98; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Uxor 2, 8</bibl>; cf. Becker, Gallus, 2, p. 115 alt.</sense></entryFree>
cinis: <entryFree id="n8063" type="main" key="ci^nis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnis</orth>, <itype>ĕris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (in <sense id="n8063.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">sing. fem.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:926" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 926</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 90</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:101:4" default="NO" valid="yes">101, 4</bibl>; Caesar, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 198, 11</bibl>; Calvus ap. Non. l. l. and ap. Charis; p. 78 p; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, 12, p. 222</bibl>; Scrib. c. 226; 230; 232; 245, Ser. c. 44; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent 27, 3</bibl>; Inscr. Orell 4479; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 657; access. form: hoc <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnus</orth>, Gloss. Labb.; <cit><quote lang="la">Sicul. Flacc. p. 140, 17,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Agrim.</author> p. 308, 3</bibl></cit>; p. 308, 5; cf. Lachm. ad Lucr 2, p. 190, and a <case>nom.</case> <orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭ-ner</orth> is mentioned by <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 5, p. 688</bibl>: 6, p. 707) [kindr with <foreign lang="greek">ko/nis</foreign>; cf. also naucus], <hi rend="ital">ashes</hi>, </sense><sense id="n8063.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (while favilla is usually the ashes that is light like dust, or is still glowing; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis favillam ab reliquo separant cinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 1, 4, § 19</bibl></cit>: cinis e <pb n="333" /> <cb n="CINN" /> favillā et carbonibus ad calfaciendum triclinium illatis exstinctus et jam diu frigidus exarsit repente, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:872" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 872</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:890" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 890</bibl>, and 4, 927; Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 78</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:74" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:28" default="NO">11, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:22:1" default="NO">12, 22, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 13, 28</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n8063.2" n="B" level="2"> From the use of ashes for scouring vessels, the proverb is derived: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus sermo haut cinerem quaeritat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 10</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8063.3" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n8063.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The ashes of a corpse that is burned;</hi> so very freq. in both numbers; in <number>plur.</number> esp. freq. in the poets and postAug. prose. </sense><sense id="n8063.5" n="(a)" level="5"> In <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur hunc dolorem cineri ejus atque ossibus inussisti?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:44:section=113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 44, § 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex tuā calamitate cinere atque ossibus filii sui solacium reportare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 49</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">128: dare poenas cineri atque ossibus clarissimi viri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 10, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecravit per fratris sui mortui cinerem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 31, 97</bibl></cit> (cf. in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">jura per patroni tui cineres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:95" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 95</bibl></cit>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:101:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 101, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:7" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:303" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 303</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 623</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 828</bibl>; 11, 211; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:33" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:521" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 521</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 615</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:129" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 129</bibl>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">death</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the person after death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Troja virūm et virtutum omnium acerba cinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et cedo invidiae, dummodo absolvar cinis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after my death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et mea cum mutuo fata querar cinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:6:34" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc non cinis ille poëtae Felix?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:36" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 36</bibl></cit>: post cinerem (<hi rend="ital">after burning the corpse</hi>) cineres haustos ad pectora pressant, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:538" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 538</bibl>.—Figuratively: <cit><quote lang="la">cineri nunc medicina datur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>when it is too late</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2</bibl></cit> (3), 14, 16.— </sense><sense id="n8063.6" n="(b)" level="5"> In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:68:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 68, 98</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedit matris cineres opertos Fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 8, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:471" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 471</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:426" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 426</bibl>; Suet, Calig. 15; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:9:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:95" default="NO">9, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4834 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8063.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The ruins of a city laid waste and reduced to ashes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cineres patriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patriae cinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 8, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 216</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8063.8" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an emblem of destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annihilation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si argentum'st, omne id ut fiat cinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quicquid erat nactus praedae majoris, ubi omne Verterat in fumum et cinerem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>had consumed</tr>, <tr>spent</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 15, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:9:12" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 9, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:12:68" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 12, 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinisculus: <entryFree id="n8064" type="hapax" key="ci^niscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭniscŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>cinis</etym>, <sense id="n8064.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little ashes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">arens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Cath. 10, 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cinithii: <entryFree id="n8065" type="main" key="Cinithii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cinithii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8065.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Africa</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinium: <entryFree id="n8066" type="main" key="Cinium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cinium</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Civium</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n8066.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town of the island of Majorca</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Sinau</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 11, § 77</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinna: <entryFree id="n8067" type="main" key="Cinna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cinna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8067.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a family name of the</hi> gentes Cornelia and Helvia. </sense><sense id="n8067.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Cornelius Cinna, <hi rend="ital">consul</hi> A.U.C. 667-670; <hi rend="ital">a confederate of C. Marius in the Roman civil war with Sylla</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:20 sq" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 20 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:21" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:19:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 19, 54</bibl> and 55.—Hence, appel., <hi rend="ital">a Cinna</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a cruel warrior</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tyrannum et Cinnam appellans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 42</bibl></cit> Dietsch.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cinnānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cinna</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <trans><tr>his party</tr>, <tr>adherents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:24" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 24</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:2:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8067.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Son of the preceding of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a follower of Lepidus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and afterwards one of the assassins of Cœsar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 9, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 10, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8067.3" n="III" level="1"> Cn. Cinna Magnus, <hi rend="ital">son of the preceding</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pardoned by Augustus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 9, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8067.4" n="IV" level="1"> C.
