Helvius Cinna, <hi rend="ital">a Roman poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">friend of Catullus</hi>, the author of a poem, now lost, called Smyrna, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:435" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 435</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:95" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:10:96" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 96</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:21:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:4:4 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 4, 4 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
cinnabaris: <entryFree id="n8068" type="greek" key="cinna^ba^ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinnăbăris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cinnăbări</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 25, 14</bibl> dub., and in some MSS. and edd. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 38, § 115</bibl>; cf. Neue, Formenl. 1, p. 555), = <foreign lang="greek">kinna/bari</foreign>. <sense id="n8068.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pigment obtained from the gum of the dragon</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-blood tree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dragon</hi>'<hi rend="ital">s-blood</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 39, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:7" default="NO" valid="yes">13, 1, 2, § 7</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Abl.</hi> cinnabari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:66" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 4, 19, § 66</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8068.1" n="II" level="1"> Some erroneously give this name to cinnabar, vermilion (minium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 38, § 115</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
cinnameus: <entryFree id="n8069" type="main" key="ci^nna^me^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnnămĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>cinnamum</etym>, <sense id="n8069.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from cinnamon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">smelling of cinnamon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nidus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">odor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 205</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crines,</quote> <trans><tr>smelling of cinnamon</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5</bibl></cit>, p. 164.</sense></entryFree>
cinnamolgos: <entryFree id="n8070" type="greek" key="cinna^molgos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinnămolgos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8070.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird in Arabia</hi> (prob. = <foreign lang="greek">kinnamolo/gos</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 33, 50, § 97</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinnamominus: <entryFree id="n8071" type="greek" key="cinna^mo_mi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinnămōmĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">kinnamw/minos</foreign>,<cb n="CIRC" />  <sense id="n8071.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from cinnamon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cinnamomum: <entryFree id="n8072" type="greek" key="cinna^mo_mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinnămōmum</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cinnămum</orth>, or <orth extent="full" lang="la">cinnămon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (post-class. access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cinnămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33</bibl>, in the signif. of ll.), = <foreign lang="greek">kinnamwmon</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">ki/nnamon</foreign> [<foreign />], <sense id="n8072.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">cinnamon</hi>: Laurus cinnamomum, Linn. </sense><sense id="n8072.1" n="(a)" level="5"> Cinnamomum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42</bibl>, §§ <cit><quote lang="la">85 and 86. —As a term of endearment: tu mihi stacte, tu cinnamomum, tu rosa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8072.2" n="(b)" level="5"> Cinnamum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:86 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 19, 42, § 86 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:308" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 308</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:13:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 13, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 32</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8072.3" n="(g)" level="5"> Cinnamon, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl> (4), 13, 8; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:10:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 10, 166</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8072.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">twigs of cinnamon; plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cinnama,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:399" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 399</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">10, 308</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:731" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 731</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:6:88" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 6, 88</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 420</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinnanus: <entryFree id="n8073" type="main" key="Cinna_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cinnānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. Cinna, I. <sense id="n8073.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
cinnus: <entryFree id="n8074" type="main" key="cinnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cinnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with <foreign lang="greek">kukew/n, ko/gxos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n8074.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixed drink of spelt-grain and wine</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 5, 174</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> p. 59, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinxia: <entryFree id="n8075" type="gloss" key="Cinxia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cinxia</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cingo</etym>, <sense id="n8075.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an appellation of Juno</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as tutelary goddess of marriage</hi>, because, acc. to Paul. ex Fest., initio conjugii solutio erat cinguli, quo nova nupta erat cincta, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=63:9" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 63, 9</bibl>; and <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 115</bibl>. —Access. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">cinctia</orth>, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 149</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinyphes: <entryFree id="n8076" type="greek" key="ci^ny^phes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnyphes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>corrupted from <foreign lang="greek">kni=pes, skni=pes</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n8076.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">very small flies</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gnats</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 12, 8, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cinyps: <entryFree id="n8077" type="main" key="Ci_nyps"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīnyps</orth>, <itype>nypis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/nuy</foreign> or <foreign lang="greek">*ki/nufos</foreign>, <sense id="n8077.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river flowing through a very fruitful region in Libya</hi>, <hi rend="ital">between the two Syrtes</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Cinifo</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Wady Khahan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:7:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 7, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 251</bibl>.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n8077.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīnyphĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to the Cinyps</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found about the Cinyps</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">chelydri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:272" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 272</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hirci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tonsor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:51" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aristae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Eutr. 1, 405</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Ov P. 2, 7, 25: Macae,</quote> <trans><tr>living near the Cinyps</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:275" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 275</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pelates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8077.2" n="b" level="4"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">Libyan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">African</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> B. Gild. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestes, i. e. serpentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 787</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
cinyra: <entryFree id="n8078" type="foreign" key="ci^ny^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭnyra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign />; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">kinu/ra</foreign>, <sense id="n8078.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the lyre</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an instrument of ten strings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 4, 54</bibl>; 13, 51.</sense></entryFree>
cinyras: <entryFree id="n8079" type="main" key="Ci^ny^ras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭnyras</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭnyra</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:195" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 195</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kinu/ras</foreign>. <sense id="n8079.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king in Assyria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">afterwards in Cyprus; father of Myrrha</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and</hi>, <hi rend="ital">by her</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of Adonis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:299 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 299 sq.</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 58" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:242" default="NO">242</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:270" default="NO">270</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Gr. Cinyran, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 98</bibl>; <case>voc.</case> Cinyrā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:380" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 380</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8079.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭnyrēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Cinyrean</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Myrrha</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:369" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 369</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:172" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 172</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Adonis</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 712</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also heros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:730" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 730</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n8079.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭnyraeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Cinyras</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora Cypri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 716</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8079.3" n="C" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭny-rēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, the same: <cit><quote lang="la">germina, i. e. Myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:1:214" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 1, 214</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8079.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A leader of the Ligurians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 186</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cio: <entryFree id="n8080" type="main" key="ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. cieo.</entryFree>
cios: <entryFree id="n8081" type="main" key="Ci^o^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cĭŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n8081.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A river in Bithynia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 32, 40, § 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8081.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A town at the mouth of the river Cios</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Ghio</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Ghemlio</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 34, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:19:4" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 19, 4</bibl>; Plin. l. c. v. Ciani.</sense></entryFree>
cippus: <entryFree id="n8082" type="main" key="cippus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">cippus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">cīpus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>kindr. with scipio; cf. <foreign lang="greek">skh/ptw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n8082.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pale</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pillar</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=258" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 258</bibl>; and specif., </sense><sense id="n8082.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A gravestone</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tombstone</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:37" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 361</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4524 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n8082.2" n="II" level="1"> In the Agrimensores, <hi rend="ital">a landmark</hi>, <hi rend="ital">boundary-stone</hi> or <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, Simplic. ap. Goes. p. 88.—* </sense><sense id="n8082.3" n="III" level="1"> In milit. lang., <orth extent="full" lang="la">cippi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a bulwark formed of sharpened stakes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
cipus: <entryFree id="n8083" type="main" key="Ci_pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Cīpus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Cippus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n8083.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fabled Roman prœtor</hi>, <hi rend="ital">upon whose head horns grew suddenly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 565</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 45, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:5:6:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 5, 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circa: <entryFree id="n8084" type="main" key="circa_1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circā</orth>, a later access. form for circum; not freq. before the Aug. per., esp. in Livy and Quintilian [acc. to Klotz, circa = circum ea; cf: antea, interea, postea, praeterea, etc.]. <sense id="n8084.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8084.1" n="A" level="2"> ( = circum, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the environs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">neighborhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen erat circa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ripaeque lacusque Responsant circa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:757" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 757</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at circa gravibus pensis affixa puella... remittat opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:3:87" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circaque quā tumor est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 28, 4</bibl>: fluvius ab tergo; ante <cb n="CIRC" /> circaque velut ripa praeceps oram ejus omnem cingebat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 18, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 33, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa Padus amnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43, 4</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">caligo, quam circa umidi effuderant montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:12:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 12, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alibi quam Romao circaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12</bibl>, prooem. § 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.2" n="B" level="2"> Circa esse, <hi rend="ital">to be in the region around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in the neighborhood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex montibus qui circa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tarquinium moribundum cum qui circa erant excepissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:41:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 41, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed non passi sunt ii, qui circa erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eversa est turris quodque circa muri erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthus et quae circa est regio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 42, § 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 16</bibl>. —Also freq. without esse, in connection with a <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multarum circa civitatum irritatis animis,</quote> <trans><tr>the towns lying around</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 30, 3</bibl>; 29, 29, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">42, 64, 2: angulus muri erat in planiorem patentioremque quam cetera circa vallem vergens ( = cetera loca quae circa erant),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora multa virūm circa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:535" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 535</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 17, 21, § 124</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.3" n="C" level="2"> Strengthened: undique circa and circa omnis ( = circum), <hi rend="ital">round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">all around</hi>: frumento undique circa ex agris convecto. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:56:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 56, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 19, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">nam et circa omnia defecerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:23:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 23, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tam procul Romani unica spes, circa omnia hostium essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 11, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 7</bibl> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">exhausto circa omni agro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 38, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:8:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 8, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:18:12" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 18, 12</bibl> Duker; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:45" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 45</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> </sense><sense id="n8084.5" n="A" level="2"> In space. </sense><sense id="n8084.6" n="1" level="3"> ( = circum, II. B.) Prop., <hi rend="ital">in the region which surrounds</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on the sides of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam (Hennam) circa lacus lucique sunt plurimi atque laetissimi flores omni tempore anni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu ligna contulerunt circa casam eam, in quā quiescebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa flumina et lacus frequens nebula est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:3:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa equum Alexandri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:15:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 15, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi robur et aes triplex Circa pectus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 6, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem circa tigres jacent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:668" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 668</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.7" n="2" level="3"> ( = circum, II. C.) <hi rend="ital">Into... around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to... round about</hi>, etc. (first in Livy): <cit><quote lang="la">Romulus legatos circa vicinas gentes misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatis circa duodecim populos missis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:23:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 23, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 26, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa domos ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes">39, 18, 2</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">29, 22, 3: circa civitates missi legati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 49, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb.; 31, 3, 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 37, 37, § 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteris circa praefectos dimissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:51:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 51, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodes circa omnes portas missi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:26:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 26, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 13, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.8" n="3" level="3"> ( = circum, II. D.) With the prevailing idea of neighborhood, vicinity, <hi rend="ital">in the region of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near by</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capuam et urbis circa Capuam occupare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa Liternum posuit castra,</quote> <trans><tr>in the neighborhood of</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 35, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernae erant circa forum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:38" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa Armeniae montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:13" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Acesinen amnem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 5, 11, § 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum auream,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificantem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.9" n="b" level="4"> As a less definite designation of place for <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Orestis liberi sedem cepere circa Lesbum insulam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa Mesopotamiam subsistere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:9:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod circa Syriam nascitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 16, § 46</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Quint. prooem. § 20: initia statim primi libri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:1:5:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">finem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virentes campos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum amor saeviet circa jecur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 25, 15</bibl></cit> (cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 17, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolor saevit in praecordiis). So esp. freq. in medic. lang.: circa faciem, nares, aures, labra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 2, 8</bibl>.—So in Livy, with names of places, approaching the more general use of later writers, <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr>, C.: <cit><quote lang="la">quadriduum circa rupem consumptum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">compositis circa Opuntem rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iisdem diebus circa Chalcidem Thoas... eandem fortunam habuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:37:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 37, 5</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multos circa unam rem ambitus fecerim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:27:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 27, 12</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.—</sense><sense id="n8084.10" n="4" level="3"> ( = circum, II. E.) In respect to persons who surround one (as attendants, friends, adherents, etc.), <hi rend="ital">around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa sibi opus esse, multa canibus (sarcast. for indagatoribus) suis, quos circa se haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:48:section=126" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 48, § 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex iis trecentos juvenes inermes circa se habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa regem erat et Phrygum turba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:1:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">e spadonibus, qui circa reginam erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:10:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 10, 25</bibl></cit>: omne sed officium circa te semper obibat turba tui sexūs, <pb n="334" /> <cb n="CIRC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:91:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 91, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod omnes circa te similes tui effecisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:83:3" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 83, 3</bibl></cit>.—In the language of the imperial court: <cit><quote lang="la">circa latus alicujus agere,</quote> <trans><tr>to wait on</tr>, <tr>altend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:27:1:30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 27, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—Hence also without a verb: circa aliquem, = <foreign lang="greek">oi( peri/ tina</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the attendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">companions of a person</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus vero circa eum gratuito aut levi fenore obstrictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:49:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 49, 7</bibl> Drak.—</sense><sense id="n8084.11" n="B" level="2"> (Peculiar to the form circa). In time, designating nearness, proximity to a definite point of time, <hi rend="ital">about</hi> (first in Livy; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">circiter): postero die circa eandem horam in eundem locum rex copias admovit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:57:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 57, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa eum mensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 18, 33, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucis ortum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lucem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam noctem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vernum aequinoctium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendas et Idus Octobr.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:8:5:10:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 8, 5, 10, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:12:2 al" default="NO">5, 12, 2 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 7 al.</bibl>—With definite numbers: <cit><quote lang="la">septimum diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">undecimam horam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:88" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lustra decem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:227" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 227</bibl>.—With general designations of time: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora illa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:143" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora Peloponnesia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Murenae Cepionisque conjurationis tempus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:93:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 93, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Magni Pompeii aetatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 12, 55, § 156</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:189" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 73, § 189</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">initia imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 7</bibl></cit>.—And in the designation of periods of time by persons who belonged to them (cf. ante): <cit><quote lang="la">circa Demetrium Phalerea,</quote> <trans><tr>about the time of Demetrius Phalereus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit> Spald.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tisiam et Coraca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:17:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Philippum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ciceronem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 1 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 1 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Attium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.12" n="2" level="3"> In numerical designations, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">nearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">almost</hi> (first in Livy for the usual ad or circiter): <cit><quote lang="la">ea fuere oppida circa septuaginta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quingentos Romanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 42, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decem milia Persarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:6:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 6, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sestertium vicies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quartum milliarium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">selibram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">singulas heminas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.13" n="C" level="2"> (Also peculiar to the form circa, and only in post-Aug. prose; esp. freq. in Quint., occurring more than seventy times.) <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> for the designation of an object about which, as if it were a centre, any thing moves, is done, etc., <hi rend="ital">around</hi>, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in respect to</hi>, etc.; depending upon substt., adjj., or verbs. </sense><sense id="n8084.14" n="1" level="3"> Upon substantives: <cit><quote lang="la">circa eosdem sensus certamen atque aemulatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:5:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa S litteram deliciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba dissensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriam suam vanitas atque jactatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc opiniones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Plin 8, 16, 19, § 48: quem pugna est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:15" default="NO">7, 1, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces inani studio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8</bibl></cit>, prooem § <cit><quote lang="la">18 et saep: rura sermo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 1, 1, § 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classicum brevis et expeditus labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:Ep 3:9:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep 3, 9, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitia nullum fastidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:20:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pan. 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">publica circa bonas artes socordia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principem novo exemplo, i. e. in principe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8084.15" n="2" level="3"> Upon adjectives: <cit><quote lang="la">non circa plurium artium species praestantem, sed in omnibus eminentissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus nostrum attentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 5, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">studia mentis erectae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lites raras ridiculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecepta utiles sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:42 al" default="NO">6, 1, 42 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis curam morosior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victum indifferens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deos ac religiones neglegentior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:69" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">administrationem imperii vacuus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 3 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">summa scelera distentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adfectationem Germanicae originis ultro ambitiosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excessus otiosus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se animati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:3 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 14, 1, 3 al.</bibl></cit> —</sense><sense id="n8084.16" n="3" level="3"> Upon verbs facetum quoque non tantum circa ridicula opinor consistere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:19" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc disputatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 5, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">priores erratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 5, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">formas litterarum haerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:114" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>. res tenues morari, Quint 1, 1, 35: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium elegendi successoris in duas factiones scindebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 13</bibl></cit>: n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:45" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceremonias, item circa omnium ordinum statum quaedam correxit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 22</bibl></cit>.!*? Circa very rarely follows its case: <cit><quote lang="la">quem circa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:48:section=107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 48, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 577</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> .3, 668</bibl>; cf. circum, II. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n8085" type="main" key="Circa2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Circa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Circe.</entryFree>
circaea: <entryFree id="n8086" type="greek" key="circaea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circaea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kirkai/a</foreign>, <sense id="n8086.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant used as a charm</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:27:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 27, 8, 38, § 60</bibl>. <cb n="CIRC" /></sense></entryFree>
circaeum: <entryFree id="n8087" type="greek" key="circaeum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circaeum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kirkai=on</foreign>, <sense id="n8087.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the plant also called</hi> mandragoras, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 94, § 147</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circaeus: <entryFree id="n8088" type="main" key="Circaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Circaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n8088.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to Circe;</hi> v. Circe, II.</sense></entryFree>
circamoerium: <entryFree id="n8089" type="main" key="circa_moeri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circāmoerĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>circa-moerus, for murus; cf. pomerium</etym>, <sense id="n8089.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the space about a wall</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on both sides of a wall</hi>: pomerium, verbi vim solam intuentes, postmoerium interpretantur esse; <cit><quote lang="la">est autem magis circamoerium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 44, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circanea: <entryFree id="n8090" type="gloss" key="circa_ne^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circānĕa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circa</etym>, <sense id="n8090.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a bird so named from its circular flight</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=43:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 43, 1</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
circe: <entryFree id="n8091" type="main" key="Circe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Circē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype> (<sense id="n8091.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Circae, Liv. And. ap. Fest. s. v. topper, p. 270; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 386</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Circes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3</bibl></cit> (4), 12, 27; <hi rend="ital">acc</hi> Circam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:2:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 2, 34</bibl> Ritschl; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D. 3, 21, 54</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">together with Circen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 19, 48</bibl></cit>; v. Inscr. Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.; abl.</hi> Circā, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:17" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 8</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 1, 15, p. 46</bibl>), <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*ki/rkh</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the daughter of the Sun and of Perse</hi> or <hi rend="ital">Perseis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Æetes</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sea-nymph</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguished for her magic arts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">whose abode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">after her flight from Colchis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">was said to be in the region of the promontory of Circeii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:31:113" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 31, 113</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 7, 20</bibl> and 282, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:205" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 205</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13, 968</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14, 10</bibl>; 14, 247 sq.; 14, 312 sq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> R. Am. 263</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">287</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 125" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 125</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:156" default="NO">156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:199" default="NO">199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 5, § 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:4:55" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 4, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:17:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 17, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 23</bibl> et saep.—Traces of divine homage paid to her among the Circeii; v. in <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1849</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:19:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 19, 48</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n8091.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Circaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">pertaining to Circe</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Circean.</hi> poculum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:17:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 17, 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>magical</tr>, <tr>poisoning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:53" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 1, 53</bibl></cit>: campi, i e. <hi rend="ital">the region of Colchis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the native land of Circe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:328" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 328</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:426" default="NO">6, 426</bibl>, where also is the town Circæum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 4, 4, § 13</bibl>: litus, <hi rend="ital">the Circeian promontory</hi>, Ov M. 14, 248; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 14:348" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 14, 348</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra,</quote> <trans><tr>Circeii</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> A 7, 10</bibl></cit>: moenia, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Tusculum</hi>, after its builder, Telegonus, the son of Circe, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:1:30" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 1, 30</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">dorsum,</quote> <trans><tr>the Hill of Tusculum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:692" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 692</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circeii: <entryFree id="n8092" type="main" key="Circe_ii"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Circēii</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (<case>abl.</case> Circēis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 33</bibl> K. and H.), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*kirkai=on</foreign>, <sense id="n8092.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the town of Circeii</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near the promontory of the same name</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in Latium;</hi> acc to the fable, named after Circe, who fled hither from Colchis (cf. the preced. art.), now <hi rend="ital">Circello</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:9" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:56 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 56 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 56, 3</bibl>; distinguished for its excellent oysters, Hor S. 2, 4, 33 Heind.— Hence, </sense><sense id="n8092.1" n="II" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Circēiensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of Circeii</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostreae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 32, 6, 21, § 62</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Circēienses</orth>, <itype>lum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of Circeii</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N D 3, 19, 48</bibl>; Liv 6, 17, 7.</sense></entryFree>
circellus: <entryFree id="n8093" type="main" key="circellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>circulus</etym>, <sense id="n8093.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small ring</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:2:5" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 2, 5</bibl>, Schol <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:379" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 379</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circen: <entryFree id="n8094" type="hapax" key="circen"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>circinus</etym>, <sense id="n8094.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a circular course</hi>: solis, <hi rend="ital">a year</hi>, Poët. in Anth. Lat. 4, 274 (Meyer, n. 1373).</sense></entryFree>
circensis: <entryFree id="n8095" type="main" key="Circensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Circensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, v. Circus, II. b.</entryFree>
circes: <entryFree id="n8096" type="main" key="circe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĕs</orth>, <itype>itis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circum-ire</etym>, <sense id="n8096.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a circle</hi> (ante- and post-class.): ut parvi circuli Anuli, sic magni dicebantur circites Ani, Varr L. L. 6, § 8 Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 22, 222</bibl>. —So of <hi rend="ital">the circumference of the circus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 381</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circinatio: <entryFree id="n8097" type="main" key="circi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circino</etym> (lit. the describing of a circle; hence, concrete), <sense id="n8097.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the circumference of a circle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a circle</hi> (a word of Vitr.): <cit><quote lang="la">linea circinationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 10 al.</bibl>—Of <hi rend="ital">the circular path of the planets</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 4</bibl>, pp. 264, 266 Bip.</sense></entryFree>
circino: <entryFree id="n8098" type="main" key="circi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>circinus</etym>, <sense id="n8098.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to round</hi> (perh. not anteAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">arbores, quae in orbem ramos circinant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 17, § 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:185" default="NO" valid="yes">16, 38, 73, § 185</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">circinatum tympanum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 332</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folia circinatae rotunditatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 23, 35, § 86</bibl></cit>—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: (Cyllenius) inclinat cursus, et easdem circinat auras, <hi rend="ital">flies through in a circular course</hi>, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:721" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 721</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque suos arcus per nubila circinat Iris,</quote> <trans><tr>vaults</tr>, <tr>arches</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 710</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circinus: <entryFree id="n8099" type="greek" key="circi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĭnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <sense id="n8099.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">m..</hi> = <foreign lang="greek">ki/rkinos</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a pair of compasses</hi>' flumen Dubis. ut circino circumductum, paene totum oppidum cingit, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diducere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:9:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 9, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: circino spatia dimetiri, id ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 4, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio circini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 13, § 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
circiter: <entryFree id="n8100" type="main" key="circi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> and <pos>prep.</pos> <etym>circus</etym>. <sense id="n8100.0" n="I" level="1"> <cb n="CIRC" /> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8100.1" n="A" level="2"> Of place, <hi rend="ital">round about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">on every side</hi>: lapidem fuisse quadratum circiter (i. e. <hi rend="ital">cubical</hi>) in mediā arcā vinctum candelis quaquaversum, Cass. Hem. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 13, 27, § 85</bibl> (cf. the passage cited under circum, I. A. 1., from <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 3</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n8100.2" n="B" level="2"> Of time, designating nearness to a fixed point, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi> (cf. ante, post): <cit><quote lang="la">illic noster est fortasse circiter triennium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter duobus mensibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diebus circiter quindecim ad fines Belgarum pervenit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horā diei circiter quartā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: circiter horā decimā noctis, Sulp. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 12, 1</bibl>: circiter luminibus accensis Uticam pervenit, Auct. B. Afr. 89 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n8100.3" n="C" level="2"> Of number, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not far from</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter quingentae species,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:5:61" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, 5, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter CCXX. naves eorum paratissimae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter milia hominum CXXX. superfuerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; 1, 27; <cit><quote lang="la">1, 31: circiter pars quarta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 56:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 56, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons suberat circiter mille passuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter duūm milium intervallo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 106:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 106, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter parte tertiā (armorum) celatā et in oppido retentā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita dies circiter quindecim iter fecerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic locus ab hoste circiter passus sexcentos aberat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad flumen Rhenum milia passuum ex eo loco circiter quinque pervenerunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum decem circiter milia ab hoste abessent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8100.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Prep.</hi> with <case>acc.</case> (orig. an <pos>adv.</pos> with <case>acc.</case> of time or of space traversed; cf. Hand, Turs. II. p. 71 sq.). </sense><sense id="n8100.5" n="A" level="2"> Of place (very rare): nisi, ut opinor, Loca haec circiter excidit mihi (cista), Plaut, Cist. 4, 2, 8.—</sense><sense id="n8100.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of time, <hi rend="ital">about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">near</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">redito huc circiter meridiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 52</bibl></cit> Ritschl: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter meridiem exercitum in castra deduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos circiter Kalendas in Formiano erimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 4, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter Idus Novembrīs in Italiā speramus fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circiter Idus Maias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem, Auct. B. Afr. 89: mensem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:8:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:2:11:7" default="NO">2, 11, 7</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Kalendas Junias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">octavam circiter horam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 47</bibl></cit>.!*? Circiter very rarely follows its case; v. Plaut. Cist. II. A. supra.</sense></entryFree>
circito: <entryFree id="n8101" type="main" key="circi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĭto</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n8101.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v freq. a.</hi> [for circuito, from circueo for circumeo], <hi rend="ital">to frequent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make busy</hi>: omnes istae artes, quibus aut circitatur civitas aut strepit. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 19</bibl>; cf.: circito, <foreign lang="greek">perinostw=</foreign>: circitat et circat, <foreign lang="greek">kukleu/ei</foreign>, Gloss. Labb.</sense></entryFree>
circitor: <entryFree id="n8102" type="main" key="circi^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĭtor</orth> (or <orth extent="full" lang="la">circuĭtor</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 53, 10</bibl>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for circumitor, from circumeo, lit. one who goes around, hence</etym>, <sense id="n8102.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A watchman</hi> (of gardens. buildings, etc.; <cit><quote lang="la">postclass.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Priap.</author> 16, 1</bibl></cit>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 117" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 117</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 1</bibl> 1.—</sense><sense id="n8102.1" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">those who go the rounds and visit the posts of sentinels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">patrols</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Mil. 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 61</bibl>, n. 7.—<hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>' CIRCITOR, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 540, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8102.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pedler</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 3, 5, § 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circitorius: <entryFree id="n8103" type="main" key="circi^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>circitor, II.</etym>, <sense id="n8103.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to patrols</hi>: dignitas, Cod. Th. 7, 22, 2, § 2.</sense></entryFree>
circius: <entryFree id="n8104" type="main" key="circi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circĭus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">cercĭus</orth>, Cato ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:28 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 28 sq.</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>perh. from circus, on account of its circular motion, but said to be a Gallic word</etym>, <sense id="n8104.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a violent wind blowing in</hi> Gallia Narbonensis; <cit><quote lang="la">to the Romans,</quote> <trans><tr>a west-northwest wind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 46, § 121</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:17:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 17, 5</bibl>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:6:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 17</bibl>; Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:22:20 sq" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 22, 20 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
circlus: <entryFree id="n8105" type="main" key="circlus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circlus</orth>, v. circulus <sense id="n8105.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
circo: <entryFree id="n8106" type="main" key="circo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circo</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>circus</etym>. = circumeo. <sense id="n8106.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To go about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">traverse</hi>: montem, Gromat. Vet. p. 326, 17; v. also circito <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n8106.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To wander through</hi>: TOTAM REGIONEM, Inscr. ap. Hermes, 1, 343.</sense></entryFree>
circos: <entryFree id="n8107" type="greek" key="circo^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŏs</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">kirkos</foreign> (a top), <sense id="n8107.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a precious stone</hi> unknown to us, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 56, § 153</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circueo: <entryFree id="n8108" type="main" key="circu^e^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭĕo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, v. circumeo.</entryFree>
circuitio: <entryFree id="n8109" type="main" key="circu^i^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭĭtĭo</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭmĭtĭo</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 61, 127</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Or. 3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Or. 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 2, 2</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>circumeo</etym>. <sense id="n8109.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going round;</hi> in milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">the rounds</hi>: circuitio ac cura (vigiliarum) aedilium plebei erat. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 6, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8109.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A circuit</hi>: muni mentum fluminis circumitione vallatum, Amm 24, 2, 2.—</sense><sense id="n8109.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a circuitous mode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a circumlocution.</hi> ita aperte ipsam rem modo locutus, nil circuitione usus es, <pb n="335" /> <cb n="CIRC" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid opus est circumitione et anfractu?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:61:127" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 61, 127</bibl></cit>, cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 32, 43</bibl>: Epicurus circuitione quādam (<hi rend="ital">in an indirect manner</hi>) deos tollens, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:17:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 17, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8109.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (abstr. pro concr.), <hi rend="ital">a place for going round something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a way</hi>, <hi rend="ital">passage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">corridor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:19" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n8109.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A circumference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compass</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
circuitor: <entryFree id="n8110" type="main" key="circu^i^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, v. circitor, <sense id="n8110.0" n="I" level="1" /></entryFree>
circuitus: <entryFree id="n8111" type="main" key="circu^i^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from circumeo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n8112" type="main" key="circu^i^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭĭtus</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">circŭmĭtus</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 12, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 62, 155</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 19, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:29:45" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 29, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:42 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 42 al.</bibl>; cf. circumeo, and v. Neue, Formenl. 2, p. 737), <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>circumeo</etym> (class. in prose and poetry). <sense id="n8112.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A going round</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a circling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">revolving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a revolution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 23, 21, § 86</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:12:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 12, 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nox et dies unum circumitum orbis efflcit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">prope med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiae Syriaeque circuitu Aegyptum petit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:17" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 5, 4, § 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8112.1" n="B" level="2"> In medic. lang., <hi rend="ital">the periodical return of a disease</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ser. Samm.</author> 95</bibl>.—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n8112.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n8112.3" n="A" level="2"> (Abstr. pro concr.). <hi rend="ital">A circuit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">compass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a way around</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurimum refert, cujus sit formae ille circuitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:26" default="NO">1, 5, 26</bibl>; Augur. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:14:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis, quem propter magnitudinem circuitus opere circumplecti non poterant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi operibus vincebant, quod interiore spatio minorem circuitum habebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">XV milia passuum circuitu amplexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; so id B G. 1, 41; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 12, 19, § 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi per mon tes circuitu praemissis, qui munirent viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 28, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:27:8" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 27, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:11:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 11, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qualis esset natura montis et qualis in circuitu ascensus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">longo circuitu petere regiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 45</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:767" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 767</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saevaque circuitu curvantem bracchia longo, Ov M. 2, 82: circumitus Siciliae quid tibi novi ostenderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8112.4" n="B" level="2"> = ambitus, <hi rend="ital">an open space left around a building</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=22" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 22</bibl>; cf. Paul. ex Fest. p 5, 4 Müll.; Inscr Marin. Fratr. Arval. p. 369.—</sense><sense id="n8112.5" n="III" level="1"> Trop </sense><sense id="n8112.6" n="A" level="2"> In rhet., <hi rend="ital">a period</hi>: in toto circuitu illo orationis, quem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">periodon</foreign>, nos tum ambitum, tum circuitum, tum comprehensionem, aut continuationem aut circumscriptionem dicimus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:61:204" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 61, 204</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Quint 9, 4, 124: modo ne circuitus ipse verborum sit aut brevior quam aures exspectent, aut longior, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Or 3, 49, 191</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 51, 198</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:23:78" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 23, 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:59" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 59</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:6" default="NO">11, 1, 6</bibl>. —In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio longiores habet saepe circuitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:60" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 60</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8112.7" n="B" level="2"> In the postAug. per., <hi rend="ital">a circumlocution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">periphrasis</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a roundabout way in speech or action; an indirect procedure.</hi> </sense><sense id="n8112.8" n="1" level="3"> Of speech, ea, quae proprie signari poterant, circuitu coeperint enuntiare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:41" default="NO">12, 10, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:7:16" default="NO">5, 7, 16</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">10, 1, 12: loqui per circuitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:15:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 15, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n8112.9" n="2" level="3"> Of action: <cit><quote lang="la">cur circuitu petis gloriam, quae ad manum posita est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:3:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: negavi circuitu agendum, sed plane jure civili dimicandum, Petr 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
